There’s a common myth that making sustainable choices is always more time-consuming than its non-sustainable counterpart. For example, mending a worn-out shirt vs. buying a new one. But is it really true? 🧐

The other night I used my fabric shaver to restore the knit sweater I’m wearing in this post. It took me about an hour to shave the whole sweater. If I had instead thrown out the sweater and decided to buy a new one, it would have taken me AT LEAST one hour to go to the store, find a similar sweater I liked, try the sweater on and then make my way home again. Even if I would have bought the new sweater online, it would probably take as long as it did for me to shave my current sweater to find and pick one that I like. And then I’d have to wait for the sweater to be shipped and arrive at my house, which would have taken at least a day. Also, no matter if I would’ve bought the new sweater in store or online, we’d also have to take into account the time of the person sewing the sweater ⏳

No matter how you do the math, making the sustainable choice actually SAVES you time (and money) when it comes to taking care of your clothes. Then again, there’s a whole discussion to be had for if we really have to benefit personally from making sustainable choices to make them. But that’s a post for another day 😉

How are you taking care of the clothes you already own? ❤️‍🩹

I love to discover new ways to wear my favourite clothes, like this pink blazer. Admittedly it’s still a bit too cold in Stockholm to be wearing an outfit like this outside, so I might switch out the blazer for a sweater when I go out later. Still, I think this outfit is a success and I will definitely be wearing it once spring comes around for real! 🌸

In other news, my February started with several days of migraine, failing my second drivers license test and being forced to change my birth control from the method I’ve been using for almost 10 years. Fun! No but really, I’m excited for this month because a lot of fun birthdays are coming up, and also, the days are getting longer again. Good times are approaching, there is no denying it 🌤️

Which clothes are you styling in new ways this month? ♻️

▫️Blazer, jeans and sneakers bought new 2+ yrs ago

Some of the highlights of 2024. I know some people don’t like these types of highlights but for me it it’s important to save all the great memories. I am a dweller of bad things so I need to try and focus on the good. ❤️

I started my own business @stenmarksarkiv , I met so many amazing people, I went to some amazing events, I spent time with my family and loved ones, I had a photoshoot of my Smarty dresses and I wrote on the book. I made some clothes. I celebrated my birthday ❤️

I hope you enjoy the glimpse of some of my best moments from 2024. 

I hope you will have a great last day of this year! ❤️

caption:
Want to know a funny story about the t-shirt I’m wearing? 👕

Well, funny may be an exaggeration. But it’s one of my boyfriends old t-shirts that he wanted to give away. But as his girlfriend, I of course get first dibs on any clothing he doesn’t want to wear anymore (and sometimes on clothes that he still wants to wear, but that’s another story 😂)!

I knew I didn’t need any more t-shirts because that is my #1 clothing category according to my @whering__ app, but what I didn’t have was any cropped t-shirts… One scissor and a couple of minutes later I had this cute, printed cropped t-shirt that can be worn as is or as a layering piece 💙

So what is the lesson here? Repurpose before anything else, I would say. Donating and recycling are very important practices to uphold a sustainable society, but as a consumer you also have a responsibility to make the most out of the things you own before passing them on to someone or somewhere else 🤝

What are your best tips for repurposing clothes (or other items)? 💡

🔹 Shirt @juditssecondhand 
🔹 Boots & bag @sellpy 
🔹 Blazer and pants bought new 2+ yrs ago

Am I obsessed with these boots? Yes, yes I am 🖤

I was on the fence about chunky boots, or chunky shoes in general, for a looong time. The main reason is that I value comfort very highly in my choice of clothing, and I suspected that chunky shoes would make my feet feel heavy, and thus, uncomfortable. But now, I happily admit that I was wrong about that! 😄 

So what made me buy these boots in the first place? Well, I’ve been on the lookout for some knee-high boots for almost two years. But I’ve recently come to the conclusion that I don’t like heels (the few heeled shoes I own are amongst my least-worn clothes). But I didn’t want boots where the sole was flat on the ground either. Chunky boots seemed like a good middle ground and this made me willing to try them out. Plus I’ve always had a thing for 70’s/80’s platform boots, like the ones ABBA used to wear, and these ones are pretty close to that, right? 🕺

Did you ever buy a clothing item that managed to surprise you? ✨

▪️ Dress (worn as a skirt) @stockholmsstadsmission

Read this before you declutter your wardrobe ‼️

I’m actually not a fan of the whole “decluttering” trend going around social media right now, mainly because I see a lot of people decluttering a ton of their stuff only to buy all of it new again. This goes for clothes, decorative items, art supplies and a lot of other things. I think this is problematic because it ultimately fuels overconsumption and makes us less inclined to practice gratitude for the things we already own 🙏

I’m definitely guilty of engaging in the same cycle with my wardrobe in the past. This is why I try to only do one “big” declutter once a year, and even then I try to keep the item count small. I also ask myself these questions before I get rid of anything from my closet:

👗 Why am I getting rid of this item (and is there a solution)? If the answer is simply “I don’t wear it” then the natural follow-up question is “Why?”. Maybe I need to style it differently. Maybe it needs to be tailored and/or mended. Most of the time there is an answer, and a solution, to the problem of not wearing a particular item. But if not, that begs the question of…

♻️ Can it be repurposed? Maybe the fancy pants you bought for the office that have become worn out can now be wfh-pants? The permanently stained t-shirt can become sleepwear? The discoloured scarf can be cut up into wash cloths for cleaning? Anything that keeps clothing in your home, and thus out of landfills, is a win for the environment. But if the item in question is still in great shape, or you just really want it out of your house, it’s time to ask the final question…

❤️ Can you find it a new home? Sadly, a lot of the clothing we send to goodwill, second hand and vintage shops still run the risk of ending up in a landfill. Check with your friends, family, workmates and other acquaintances if they could use some of your decluttered clothes before sending them away. 

Let me know what you think about this! I’d love to hear your thoughts about decluttering one’s wardrobe, and/or in general!💡

#slowfashion #sustainability #secondhandsverige #decluttering #sustainablefashion

My fashion resolutions for 2024 ⬇️

♻️ Keep buying secondhand first
📍 Buy local secondhand first instead of online
🌱 Look for natural materials instead of synthetics 
📦 Move all of my clothes inside (no more storing away seasonally) and do weekly capsules
👗 Wear dresses more often!

Last year was my first year of vowing to only buy secondhand clothing, with the exception of socks, stockings and underwear. I almost made it through the entire year before buying some new sportswear for a ski trip, which I could have bought second hand with a bit more planning. Nevertheless, I think 2023 was a huge success for my wardrobe and my personal style! And that’s largely because of my previous resolution, I think 😍
 
What do you think of my 2024 fashion resolutions? Maybe you have some of your own as well? I’d love to hear what they are! 🙌

But I guess this is another aspect of being true to your personal style. Because even if I adore the way that I look when I’m dressed in a super colourful outfit, I also have days where I don’t feel like dressing like that - at all! And that doesn’t mean that I don’t have a personal style (which was a belief that I held for a very long time). Even if my style consists of a broader spectrum of colours and items, I would still be able to point out an outfit that isn’t my style at all 💡

A new remake. ❤️

I found a broken dress with beautiful beads and sequins. I bought it and cut off the piece with the beads. I then placed it on the back of a blazer I had at home. The colour match was amazing. It took really long to sew on the piece and it was really difficult but I am really glad with the results. ❤️

What do you think?

Did you know? This account turned one year a couple of days ago! 🥰🎉

On march 3d to be exact, but I was sick at the time. But now I’m back, and I just want to say thank you to all of you lovely people that have decided to follow me on here since then 💕 I’ve learned so much from the #slowfashion community here on Instagram, which has also led me to take a greater interest in #slowliving , as well as #sustainability overall! ♻️

Some of you might not know this, but I am an active member of a Swedish political party called @miljopartiet and a board member of their local faction @miljopartiet_botkyrka . Starting and maintaining this account has definitely gone hand-in-hand with my political engagement, and will continue to do so. I see a lot of people on this platform who are worried about the future of humanity, all while feeling powerless and not knowing how to help. I would say that if you have the time and energy, try engaging in local politics! It is such an awesome feeling to surround yourself with people who want to help society in the same ways you do. You can get that from social media, of course, but I found it to be even more powerful to experience irl as well 💪

Thank you again for your support, I hope you have a lovely day 🌸

▪️Pants, shoes and bag @sellpy 
▪️Belt @rodakorset_botkyrka 
▪️T-Shirt is a hand me down

Introducing another one of my vintage dresses.

This one is a late 60s/ early 70s dress from the Swedish brand Bröderna Magnusson. 
The company was founded in Borås in 1934 by the brothers Tage and Yngve Magnusson. 
Borås is considered to be Swedens textile city. A lot of clothes used to get made here. 

I really love this dress beacuse of the shiny fabric, the print, the colour, the belt, the details on the sleeve and beacuse of the model of the dress. 

I found this dress at @tradera some years ago. 

I hope you will have a fantastic Tuesday.

‼️ Important announcement! This Wednesday (23/8) I’ll be at Alby Centrum between 17-19:30 with @miljopartiet_botkyrka , come by if you want to chat about sustainability, climate change, local politics… or just chat! 😄 Hope to see you there 🌻

In other news, I’m taking my second mandatory driving class today (also known as Risktvåan) and I’m a little bit nervous, but mostly I think it’ll be a lot of fun! For those of you who are unfamiliar, you basically get to drive around on a course and feel what it’s like to drive when it’s really wet or icy on the road ❄️🌧️ Wish me luck! 

I also had a lot of fun taking pictures today, can you tell? 😍

Couldn't leave this vintage wool coat from Scapa of Scotland. Such great quality and tailoring. I used to glance at the Scapa brand and collected the luxury paper lookbooks as a youngster (as well as those from Strenesse and Agnès B). As a student in the late 90's I sometimes bought wool jackets and skirts from a similar style brand Josephine & Co in the sales. Not sure though if this Scapa jacket still is my style, even if Miuccia Prada recently decided that coats are getting more fitted. It's good to start with an inexpensive vintage quality jacket to find out if I'm ready for more fitted outerwear myself. I eventually will sell this red wool beauty further, but not yet. 

#allasecondhandfynden @morecolourtothepeople #secondhandfashion #secondhandiförstahand #secondhandfirst #makesecondhandyourfirstchoice #prelovedfashion #secondhandoutfit #outfitinspo #outfitoftheday

Last week while browsing the 2nd hand market for 'yellow leopard' with with a look from Bottega Veneta Resort 2025 on my mind, my eyes caught this leopard coat. Such a good print, quite like the very luxury By Malene lamb fur coat I got a closer look at last week in Stockholm. This coat was from Lafayette, a nylon shell with black fleece lining, made in France. A lot of good vintage signs alltogether. The French size 40 initially hold me back, but I decided to give it a go for 150 sek. That was a good decision, even if I definitely not needed another coat 😜. I'm still looking for a yellow leopard skirt btw...

The whole outfit is vintage/secondhand. 

#secondhandfashion #secondhandinspo #secondhandoutfit #secondhandiförstahand #secondhandfirst #prelovedfashion #vintagecoat #makesecondhandyourfirstchoice

Tried to get the vibes from Prada AW24 in my outfit this rainy Monday, day 1 of the #stylechallenge #allasecondhandfynden with @morecolourtothepeople. Today's theme is "all the skirts" and that's a easy one for me. I have an awfull lot of skirts in my closet 😜.

Good skirts are pretty easy to find in good shape 2nd hand (in my opinion). Don't look to much what the size tag says, try them on or ask the seller for the waist in cm. And try them with shoes, bc most skirts look a bit strange without, especially when You wrongly think that You're not a 'skirt person'. There is a skirt for every (wo)man, I promise! 

Secondhand jumper and bag, vintage wool skirt, about 6 year old coat Didriksons, Mary Jane shoes Vagabond last year.

#secondhandfashion #secondhandiförstahand #secondhandfirst #prelovedfashion #haveathingforskirts #makesecondhandyourfirstchoice #secondhandoutfit #vintageskirt

Tuesday and another #secondhandoutfit with a little focus on luxury secondhandfinds, Today's theme in #stylechallenge #allasecondhandfynden hosted by @morecolourtothepeople to counteract this Black Friday week.

The whole outfit is vintage/ secondhand except for the tights. 

Myself I made a list of consumables to find on discount during Black Friday e.g. tights, toileteries, perfume, footbollsocks, batteries, cat food, earpods etc. I also checked out a home steamer, which has been on my wishlist for a while.
Nothing wrong with saving some money 😀.

#secondhandfashion #secondhandiförstahand #secondhandfirst #prelovedfashion #makesecondhandyourfirstchoice
#secondhandnovember #outfitoftheday #outfitinspo

A vintage LL.Bean chore jacket for #allasecondhandfynden  with @morecolourtothepeople. Today's theme is 'jackets'.
I bought this vintage jacket the day after Prada showed their oversized distressed canvas jackets for  AW24. I knew it would by a general  trend, but hadn't expect to see it so widespread. A lot of cheep (and expensive) fast fashion versions suddenly popping up everywhere, which felt so disappointing! 
However, after the 'storm' I happily still feel, more than a half a year later, that this kind of men's jackets suit me. 

Bought a new wool beanie in the best green hue Today! Made in Sweden 😀.

My Black Friday sum up so far besides toileteries and Eborian makeup, cat litter,  cat food, panties, tights, fleece sweaters, fotbollsocks and some sportgear for my children. Still thinking about a stationy steamer and also looking for new earpods for my daughter.

The whole outfit is secondhand except for the shoes and  the beanie.

Yesterday was the Nobel day and we celebrated and got dressed up at my work. 

I went with this golden 40s dress and the kids at school thought I looked like a queen ❤️

The thing I would love about attending the real Nobel party is putting on an amazing dress. One of my least favourite sports is sitting down and eating for hours so I would skip that part and go straight to the party. Or who am I kidding I would probably go home and sleep 😆 I am more of an early party, fast dinner, go home early kind of girlie these days. And I would rather spend time with people I love and feel comfortable around. ❤️

I also know that these lovely Instagramers: @erikas_garderob and @shirtupanddance are having their style challenge #klänningsveckan I know this would be perfect for tomorrows prompt. So sorry for sharing it one day early ❤️

The dress was bought from the lovely @ropa_kakan ❤️

I hope you will have an amazing Wednesday. ❤️

Apperently my Instagram is broken according to all the emails I get from people who wants to fix it. 😆

Well I don’t remember dropping my account to the floor or abusing it in any other way. I kind of treated it the same way as always. 

The difference is time and COVID. When I started my account it was during the pandemic when people didn’t have all that much to do and we bonded here and had so much more time to spend here. 
A lot of people went back to the normal life and don’t have the same time to spend here. 

For me it is the same. I don’t have the same amount of time to spend here. But I really love to post and communicate with those of us who still are here. I love to Spread awareness about sustainable style, normalising second hand outfits first or shopping in your closet. Sharing my knowledge about vintage and encourage you to find your personal style. So I share things here for me and for those of you who still see my posts. ❤️

Thank you so much for being here! ❤️❤️❤️

I hope you will have a fantastic day ❤️

I recreated a Pinterest outfit! ✨ You can find the inspiration for this outfit linked in my story 🔗

Recreating outfits from Pinterest, Instagram or YouTube is another great way to find new uses for the current clothes in your wardrobe, instead of buying new clothes 🤗 For this outfit, I simply typed “denim vest outfit” in the Pinterest search bar and got a ton of fun outfit ideas that I hadn’t thought of myself. 

If you haven’t tried it yet, you definitely should! Start with that item that’s stuck in the back of your closet that you never wear, I promise that you’ll find a new use for it 💖

Häng med till en riktigt stor second hand & vintagebutik i Stockholm som jag aldrig har besökt innan. På Ryttargatan 7 i Solna, Stockholm, ligger @ryttargatansvintage , hela 600 m2 proppfylld med prylar. Den här butiken är verkligen värt ett besök när du är sugen på att botanisera bland prylar, porslin, tyger, glas och kläder. Se hela videon och vad som fick följa med hem via länk i bio!

I thought this outfit would be perfect for todays Streetwear Barbie prompt 👟

This outfit has actually been one of my favourites since last year, when I wore it a lot to the office during summer 🌸 Back then I used to wear my trusty Nike Air Force-sneakers, which I wear with e v e r y t h i n g (take a look at my feed and you’ll see what I mean). I’m back! 🧡 Where have I been, you might ask? Well, turns out I managed to catch Covid during my absolute favourite time of the year. I missed a bunch of important things and am still quite salty about it, so I’m just going to remind everyone to check yourself an extra time before you go out of the house with symptoms. Help each other to stay safe and healthy 🙏 

On a related note I still get tired and out of breath very quickly, so it was a bit hard for me to take these pictures today. Check for the bonus meme at the end of the post instead ✨

I become a different person when it’s sunny and warm outside, and I’m not sorry about it ❤️‍🔥

No but seriously, spring has arrived for real in Stockholm with temperatures clocking in at around 20 degrees Celsius all week! I truly, truly can’t describe how happy this makes me. It might sound silly, but my mood is so dependent on the weather that it’s almost unreal. I guess it’s a side effect of living in a place where it’s dark and cold almost every hour of the day for 6 months a year. But that doesn’t matter now, right now everything is awesome ☀️☀️ 

Not sure if this outfit qualifies for #mismatchmay, I guess maybe for the layering prompt? Oh well 😅

T-shirt, pants and bag from @sellpy 
Other items from various stores, the newest one bought last summer

En #cameraroll från senaste tiden 🎞️

1: Sommar MVPs! Tagit fram den analoga kameran igen, ser redan fram emot att framkalla
2: #90svibe jag tycker helsvart är extra snyggt på sommaren
3: Godaste efterrätten hos @cafenizza 
4: Staycation i skärgården, drömmigt ställe @smadalarogard 
5: Inget Italien i år, då får man äta extra mycket gelato, eller hur?
6: Min gravid-lyx-grej, gå på pedikyr. Älskar #prada sandalerna från @sellpy 
7: Lever i skjorta från #sellpy och såklart stråhatten från @hericane_thelabel 
8: Ständig sommarcrush på allt med 🐚 Detta vintagehalsband köpte jag för något år sedan på #vestiariecollective från #ugocorreani älskar #statementjewelry 
9: Snabba #vintagechanel bågar via #vestiarecollective kan dock ej bestämma mig om jag ska behålla dem eller sälja..
10: Nya och gamla sommarbeuatyfavoriter! Kan ej leva utan min borste från #masonpearson dyr men håller många år. Enda ögonskuggan man behöver från #diorbeauty i färgen ”cashmere” och en ny ögonbrynsfavorit ”the brow glue” den håller verkligen brynen på plats. C-vitaminserum från #klairs och spf från #vichy älskar formulan och blir otrolig glow!

Confession of a thrift shopaholic. 

How I went from: I see it, I want it, I get it! To a more conscious thrift shopper. 

First of all I believe that it is easy to over-consume second hand clothes when you start going from fast fashion to second hand and that is all right. I think it is part of the process so don’t feel bad when people who have come further in their slow fashion journey start to talk about overconsumption with second hand, you will get there too but if you are a beginner then let’s just applaud that you have started to buy second hand first! ❤️

I used to buy sooooo much clothes second hand and in the beginning I came home with so much that I ended up not using. I went from not finding anything cus I didn’t know how to search to finding so much treasures that just screamed my name. All the clothes I didn’t end up using gave me a guilty conscience. 

I then started to do like this: 
-first I take a basket when entering the store.
- I take everything I like and put it in the basket.
- I go to a less crowded part and go through all my finds. 
-do I need it? Will it work with my existing wardrobe? Can I come up with at least 3 different outfits with it?
-if it’s a yes; then it goes down in my basket again and if it’s a no I go back with it. 
-the things that have made it now has to be tried on or measured with a measuring tape. If it fits then it goes back to the basket if it doesn’t fit I take it back. 
- if I have time I go to look at furniture and other sections of the thrift store. 
-I then go through the basket a last time and now I really have landed in what I want to buy so I keep the keepers and leave the other things in the store. 
-this takes time but I don’t end up with things I don’t end up using anymore. 

I also don’t shop as much as I used too but that is beacuse I love what I have in my wardrobe and I am more picky with what I want to add. 

Do you recognise this? Where are you in your second hand journey?

✨ Introducing another one of my vintage dresses. ✨

This is from the Swedish vintage brand Hyltea. Hyltea was founded in Hyltebruk in 1946. They made dresses, pyjamases and other clothes for ladies.

I love the model of the dress, the colour, the print, the unique skirt and the gold details in the fabric. 

I would say it is from the late 60s or the early 70s. 

I’va had it for many years and I still remeber how glad I was when I found it at @andravarvethogdalen it is such a gem 💎 

I hope you will have a fantastic Tuesday ❤️

It’s friday! Lets sparkle and shine! ✨✨

I just love this dress from ROTATE that I found from @vinted I just feel instantly fantastic fabulous when I put it on. It is so comfortable and the colour is AMAZING! And the sparkle is fantastic too! 

@lisacaspani.slowfashion is writing about clothes being an armor and a mood changer and this dress is helping me cover up a really tired teacher who started her day crying beacuse she woke up early and had a dream that her co-workers where angry at her. It felt so real that my PMS mind convinced that it was the truth and I felt so useless. Woke my husband up and had him give me a big hug before I left the house. When I got to work everything was just fine and no one was angry with me. It turned out to be a great day and now I am enjoying a chai latte at one of my favourite cafes all by myself ☺️✨

I hope you will have an amazing Friday ❤️

I am amazed of all the support and kindness this corner of Instagram always gives. It was so refreshing to find a place where people actually are nice and threat each other with respect. 
I love the sisterhood and the women supporting women.
In the beginning of my account it was the pandemic so everything just happened online. But when you got to meet all these lovely and amazing people and they where just as kind as they where online I was so grateful. 

Every time I meet people from here I am amazed how genuine they are and how including. I have not come across any snobbery just kindness and love. 

Thursdays gala was a tribute to slow fashion but it was also a display on love, sisterhood and kindness. I hope you all felt just as included as I always feel. ❤️

I love the slow fashion family! It is the best and you know what the best part is: there is always room for more. ❤️❤️❤️

Thank you again @slowfashionhubstockholm and @clarionstockholm @ems.secondhand @vintage.vitalite @stinaloving you created magic! Thank you for all your hard work! ❤️❤️❤️

🤍 The Slow fashion gala 2024 outfit. 🤍

What I wore for @slowfashionhubstockholm and @clarionstockholm event: Slow fashion galan 2024

I went with an all white look for the gala. 
I found this broken tulle skirt when my local charity shop @rodakorsetsecondhand had a sale to make room for new things. It had so much tulle so I fell in love and bought it. When I thought about a gala outfit this skirt came up in my mind so I fixed it and made it wearable again. 

The next thing that came to my head was this epic bow from HM innovation. Found this via @sellpy and had used it before. It looked amazing with the skirt so now I just had to decided what to wear under it. 

I tried many different shirts but I always returned to the sequins shirt that I found at @myrorna.mastersamuelsgatan @myrorna 

Now I had to decide what shoes to wear and how to fix my hair. I tried many different shoes but I thought it looked best with these black boots that I found via @sellpy 
Since the shoes where black I knew I must add my hat from @hericane_thelabel

I added gold earrings from @vintage.vitalite and a gold braclet that I recently found @stadsmissionenssecondhandsthlm in Södertälje. 

So my look has elements that are repaired, reused, recycled, supporting a small business by two amazing women and with things from 3 different charity shops. 🤍

I hope you will have an amazing day ❤️❤️

I only went 100% #secondhandfirst as of January 2023, but preloved clothing was never a weird concept to me. Of course, when I was younger I didn’t even know that “second hand” was a thing. For me it was normal to wear hand me downs from my mother, my sisters, relatives, friends or sometimes even the children of my parents friends. I could lie and say that it was because my family has always been extremely environmentally aware, but for the most part it was because of money. My parents worked really hard at jobs that don’t always pay that well, so to buy new clothes for three girls who just kept growing was too expensive at times. 

I think that’s why the idea of buying and wearing clothes that have already been worn by someone else has never been a turn-off for me. I know some people still consider clothing that was previously worn by a complete stranger to be “icky”. But you know what else is icky? Having a person not even get paid a liveable wage to work overtime sewing everyday, just so that you can buy a brand new piece of clothing and feel on trend. 

If you struggle to adjust to buying second hand first, I would recommend the following:

🤝 Explore second hand clothing with someone who you trust and feel comfortable around. If they can wear it, so can you! 

💡 Look around for all the different ways to buy second hand. There are so many different ways to do so today and I guarantee that you will feel comfortable with at least one of them!

🙅‍♀️ Lastly, if you get really, REALLY turned off by buying second hand, I recommend to set a low-buy restriction on yourself for a month, 6 months or a year. Stop shopping for trends, buy only the absolute necessities and learn to love what you have (I will probably have to write a separate post on this one) 

How did you learn to buy #secondhandfirst ? 🌸

My brain at 5am this morning.
Trying to write something with an overwhelmed brain thrinking about my full time work as a teacher 45h/week, writing a book, preparing the last jury work for the Slow Fashion Gala, my own company and still have time for my family. 

What to wear for the gala. Goals for my lessons. Anserwing mails for the book. What to plan for the substitute on Friday. Should I bring more clothes for the store in Stockholm. Did I wash the clothes my son and daughter need for the week? What do my son need for his baptism? Writing a presentation for the book. Planing my own lessons. 

I love all these parts of my life but at the moment there is a lot going on in every area so I am kind of tired but also very happy beacuse I look so much forward to the gala! It gives me so much joy writing this book. I love my work as a teacher and my students. I get so much love from them and my old students. My husband is amazing and does so much to help me. I am so glad my son wants to be part of an after school activity. I can’t give my company so much time at the moment.

It is hard to find a good balance when you find joy in so many things and love being part of things and helping people. How do I use my energy right? I am a restless soul so I am not good at taking it easy. 

Can anyone relate? ❤️

I hope you will have a fantastic day ❤️

Just a tribute post to the coat I made.

When I saw this bedspread at my local charity shop I thought it would make a great coat. I looked at it but left it. When I returned to the charity shop a week later it was still there. So this time I bought it. 

I looked for coat inspo on Pinterest.  I then draw a coat and combined elements from several coats like puffy sleeves, a long coat, a long ribbon in the waist, large pockets. 

When I started to measure the fabric I realized that I had to shorten it to get wide sleeves and it wouldn’t be enough fabric for the large puffy sleeves of my dreams. So I did some alternations to make the most of the fabric. 

I think it turned out so good and I am so happy with the result. 

I hope you will have a great Saturday ❤️

The bedspread is bought from @rodakorsetsecondhand in Mariefred.

Scooby doobie doo! 

I love dressing up and creating coustumes. This is one I have worn many times before. 

I loooved Scooby Doo growing up and my favourite character was and still is Daphne Blake. 

One of the perks of being a teacher is that you can dress up and wear costumes from time to time. 

This is what I wore on the last day before their autumn break. 

I really loved turning my hair orange and now I really would like to make it permanent again. 

For the first time I wore this costume I made a box of scooby snacks out of an old cereal box and paper. I forced my hubby to be Fred 😂 he wouldn’t shave of his beard for the party and he wore my jeans and my sweater ☺️❤️
Will try to find a photo and share in my stories. 

The purple vintage dress is from @beyondretro_zinken @beyondretro @beyondretronordics 
The scarf I made out of old fabric found at a charity shop and the lilac details are made out of old fabric from a charity shop. 

I hope you will have a fantastic Halloween. My work for today is taking the bike down town and buying a lot of candy and hope that some kids will come trick or treating later today 👻🎃

Introducing another one of my vintage dresses. 💚

This is a danish beauty that the lovely and kind @sannkraft found at a thrift store and asked me if I would like to buy. She then sent it to me. So lovely and kind 💚🩵💚

It is such a beauty and I think it is from the late 60s/ the early 70s. 

I love the colour, the print, the fabric, the dress model the shiny gold details in the fabric and that it is most likely one of a kind. 

I don’t know anything about the brand. I think the tag says: Brilûna model. It also says that it is made in Denmark. 

Most of the other dresses, from this brand, I have found online are more of party dresses so that might be their companys thing or it is just that the everyday dresses where used and disposed of when they where out of style/broken while the party dresses stayed in people’s wardrobes and where not used as much.

Have you ever come across this brand before? 

On the last slide you can see me wearing the dress for the first time. It was New Year’s Eve and we where up in Umeå and I felt absolutely amazing ❤️

I hope you will have an amazing day ❤️

A Saturday afternoon in and around the house, experimenting a little with a fitted secondhand checked oxford shirt (inspired by similar shirts at Zara recently) and my old secondhand Bally heels I got in return from the consignment store yesterday. 
By wearing this combo I feel that I'm thrown back a decennium, but the vintage suede jacket makes the outfit a bit more updated. I also tried with a fake fur secondhand jacket and the lilac fake fur collar from my son's winter jacket I bought him Yesterday. 
I'm wondering why I'm trying to get these pieces work, while I do have so many more favourite items in my wardrobe and also better outfit ideas instead.
Btw, I'm still thinking about decorating the suede jacket à la Miu Miu...

The whole outfit is vintage/secondhand.

Earlier today I went through a category of my wardrobe, like I regularly use to do when it's raining on a Sunday morning. It every time surprises me to find items that suddenly doesn't feel right anymore, despite they're fitting (great).
For today's outfit I took out my dad's 70's Wrangler shirt I inherited as a 16-year old over 30 years ago. Besides some jewellery and one or two bags, this is the longest living item in my closet that I still am wearing. 
I matched the shirt with baggy jeans and a statement necklace, both secondhand. Old pointy croc derbyshoes from Ecco.

Since 2017 I have walked away from fast fashion and almost everything in my wardrobe is bought second hand. 

Since 2008 my interest in finding clothes second hand started. And my friends Hanna thought me how to find things in stores I used to find overwhelming. 

In about 1988 I remember that I got a dress who my bestie also had and I styled it with a belt. This is where the style interest started. 

Since about 1986 I started playing with my granny’s button jar and her left over fabric from work. She used to make clothes to our Barbie dolls. 

In 5:th grade everybody in school had a body in three different colours and with a flower print. It came in gray, maroon or dark blue. We also had heavy hair inspiration from Beverly Hills. 

In high school I started searching for my own style and I tried many different styles. I also found alternative rock and started dressing so that people would know my music taste by just looking at me. 

Style has always been a big part of my life and I love to express myself with my style. 

Well this post become a walk down memory lane. 

I hope you will have a fantastic day ❤️

A sustainable tribute to my favourite team! ❤️🖤

I am a big fotball/soccer fan and one of my favourite teams are @acmilan from Italy. 
The Milan shirt is my husbands old one from the late 80s and it has Gullits name on the back. 
Milan won their game in Champions League yesterday 🙌❤️🖤

My dad has always been a huge sports fan so he spread his interest on to me and my sisters. I have played fotball/soccer myself and I was known for reading the game good but I wasn’t that fast and I played kind of hard. Both my sisters played as well. The middle sisters team won the Stockholm division for their age and my dad was the coach. 
My mum is also really into sports and so was my grandmum. If there was sports on the TV when we visited the TV would stand on. So sports has always been a part of my life ❤️

This is a proud outfit repeater moment. 

I hope you will have a fantastic Wednesday ❤️

Here are stills from the amazing afternoon I spent with Gizelle @shoevagirl 

First we went to @myrorna.mastersamuelsgatan where Gizelle found two amazing blazers. @stinaloving met up with us there. She found a pair of epic furry boots and we couldn’t believe we had walked pass them. 

After that we went to @greenlittleheart and checked out there second hand section. We met up with the lovely @slowfashionangela and got some sparkling vine . We also met the sweet @oliviabrillantes 

After that we went to @slowfashionhubstockholm and met up with @vintage.vitalite and @stinaloving also here we drank some sparkling vine. We also checked out their awesome second hand and design clothes. 

It was so nice to meet another Instagram friend and this one is my first international one. Gizelle is just so kind and sweet as she is online. It was so amazing to be able to meet her and spend some time togeather. ❤️

Thank you for such a wonderful day ❤️

Introducing another one of my vintage dresses. 

This is a more recent one bought from @kerstis_vintagebod 

It is from the Swedish brand Magna of Sweden and it is a 70s dress. 

I think it has such a great print and I love the colours. The dress model is also great. I love that it has a matching belt.

Yesterday’s look was playful, creative, quirky and fun. 

Thought it was about time to let my curtain dress, I made out of a pair of old curtains, come out and play again. And I added pink wide pants and the macrame dress I made on top. 

Sometimes this is what I need in an outfit other times I go with totally different words. 

One thing I am totally sure of: no one on planet earth looked just like me yesterday. And for 99,9 precent of the population they are just thankful for that but 0,01 percent might see this as somewhat interesting. 😂

I kind of like the idea that I am all alone with this look. I am shouting out that I am unique and weird. I always felt weird and like I didn’t fit in my whole life and now I am finally fine with not being everyone’s cup of tea. Because I am a unique coctail with colourful fruits and sparkle on top. I am more is more. I am a freak. I am a weirdo. And I do think I belong here. (Referents to the song creep beacuse always hear lyrics in my head)

I am actually glad when I don’t look like everyone else and that is what I love about vintage fashion, sustainable and personal style, I get to be 100% me. 

I know unique styles is not for everyone and the amazing thing with second hand clothes is that whatever style you are going for you can find it second hand. Since trends go in cycles, beacuse the fast fashion companies wants to sell more new clothes so that one rich man can make more money, everything is already out there. So go search the second hand stores and hand pick items that will make your wardrobe more you. And don’t give anymore of your money to that one rich man who apparently thinks he is superior to the people who, under slave like conditions , have to make his companies clothes. Thank you ❤️

Yay! I feel so good beacuse I finally was abel to create something this weekend. 

I made this amazing coat out of an old bed spread I found at my local charity shop @rodakorsetsecondhand 

I just LOVE how it turned out. 

Gonna try to explain my creative process. 
When I found the fabric last week I thought about making a coat. But I was in a bad mood in the store and didn’t end up buying anything. When I revisited the store one week later the fabric was still there and this time I bought it. 
I held it up and thought that the round corners would look amazing in front. 
I then went to Pinterest to find inspo and knew I wanted a long coat with puffy sleeves. I drew a model and figured out how to put a coat togeather and how many parts I would need. 
I also looked at my own coats to see how they were put togeather. 
Since I had the fabric I had I had to choose between a short coat with puffy sleeves or a longer coat without puffy sleeves. I went with the long option. 
Then I started to cut out the pieces I needed. 
I zigzagged the edges and then started putting pieces togeather. 
I had to decide if I wanted it to be light or a little bit darker. I went with the light version but had second thoughts all through the process 😂

I made sleeves and added pockets. I also made a really long belt. 

I am so glad that there was almost no left over fabric! 🙌

I hope you like it. I made it with my pink Singer simple  from @singer_sverige 

#becreative #creativeprocess #memade #remake #cirkulärtmode #hållbartmode #hållbarstil #singersimple #singersverige #sewsomething #coat #rödakorsetfynd

What you love to wear is much more important then what others may or may not think. 

I celebrate me each day I put on an outfit and it feels great. 

Yes I sometimes have been asked, where I am going, or if I am going to a masquerade, what’s the special occasion and so on. But that is just because I don’t dress like everybody else. I do stand out in a crowd. 
But more often I actually get nice comments from people. 

Dare to wear what you love ❤️

Have a fantastic Wednesday. ❤️

caption:
Here are 7 random things about me: 

I am superstitious and have learnt a lot of these from my grandma. Not walking under laters, not putting keys on table, that in means bad luck if a black cat runs over the road and so on. 

Right now I am rewatching Gilmore Girls and I am on season 7. 

When I was little I used to pretend that I was Storm in x-men so that I could control the weather and fly! 🙌

I really enjoy exploring new citys and I like walking around looking at old buildings and church’s. 

My nickname growing up was the living jukebox but it was supposed to be hurtful but I really always have loved singing so I didn’t mind and I kept on singing. 

I have never learnt to eat coriander or drink coffee. 

I’m an alternative rocker but I have turned into someone who thinks: a good tune is a good tune and that usually is a song I can sing along too 😁

Do we have anyone of these in common? ❤️

Yesterday I visited Stockholm beacuse now you can find my store @stenmarksarkiv at @greenlittleheart 🙌

On the 29 th of April 2023 this skirt was first posted in a post in my feed. 

Since then I have worn it more then 12 times. 

What made this a good buy? 
It had a lot of elements I love in a good piece of clothing. 
It is vintage.
One of a kind.
In a fabulous green colour. 
In a really great model. 
And will work with a lot of my existing wardrobe. 

Before I bought it I created five looks with existing pieces of clothing in my wardrobe in my head. 

I have practiced buying second hand and vintage  clothing since before 2007 and since 2017 I have only been buying my clothes second hand. I know it takes time to learn how to buy second hand clothes. And even after all this time I still make a buy that I think will work but then it just get stuck in the wardrobe. And that is ok. If you are here for perfect I won’t fool you. Run fast away from my feed.
 I am a 43 year old teacher who am trying my best to spread awareness about sustainable style and slow fashion. I do it on my free time because I really enjoy it. This is not work for me. I don’t make a penny or a Swedish krona on this account. But this account give me so much more then money ever will. 

I have found my sustainable tribe with a lot of loving and kind people from all over the globe and that gives me hope. ❤️

Thank you for supporting me and for leaving nice encouraging comments, I really appreciate it and I really hope you want to continue to follow the slow journey of my fashion and style story. ❤️

Happy Saturday all you lovely people. 💚

There’s hope, there’s a silver lining! ❤️

I hear a voice calling and it is telling me to choose a more sustainable life. 
To choose kindness both towards others and to myself. 
To lead with a good example. 
To be humble. 

I am not perfect but we don’t need perfect. We need a lot of people doing good enough. Each step towards a more sustainable life is a huge win. 

Don’t build a high fence around the sustainability concept, make it a small threshold with a large welcome sign! ❤️

I might just be a shallow instagrammer sharing photos of my outfits on a daily basis but I do try to spread awareness and show people that sustainable style can be so much fun and personal. 

I hope you will have an amazing Monday.

If you buy clothes you love you are more likely to wear them. 

This type of yellow is not this seasons color but yellow has been in style Since the eighteenth century when there was a great deal of interest in the exotic and people started to use yellow as a fashionable colour. (From google arts and culture) 

I love this dress and I have worn in more then the 7 times you see me in it on the second photo. I love that you can style it in so many different ways and that I always feel beautiful when I wear it. 

It is probably not on trend but I am a personal style rebel not a micro trend slave. 

I hope you will have a fantastic Saturday! 💛💛

Can you guess who my thrifty fashion inspo is for this #WomanCrushWednesday everything worn is secondhand!

It’s our slow fashion Queen @karins.vintagestyle, 
Karin curates incredible outfits blending secondhand finds & vintage pieces. Truly an inspiration for all to embrace more eco-conscious fashion choices while showcasing the creativity and beauty in reusing and repurposing clothes from the past. 

And I couldn’t stop at one outfit as I love her style and really wanted to try her ingenious use of a macrame layered over another. I’m also wearing a particular blue colour in one outfit - the 60s piece and it’s such a particular shade of blue I could never name and Karin wears it a lot, so in this house we call it KARIN BLUE 🎽

If I just would add some white makeup to my face I would become a ghost. 👻 

I really enjoy Halloween and since my epic David Bowie coustume from 2009 I have created my costumes myself from things I found at the thrift store or things I already had in my or my family’s wardrobe. 
I made a gun for Han Solo out of some old milk cardboard. I made the mad hatters hat out of cardboard and old news papers. I created a house that my daughter could wear on her head when she became Alice who drunk something in wonderland and become really large. 

It is sustainable, creative and so much fun. 🎃

Today I am gonna reuse one of my most worn costumes and become one of my number one girl crush when I was a kid: Daphne Blake. 💜💚
I can’t find Scooby doo or the box of Scooby Snacks I made but I’ll make it work. 🔍🔎🔍🔎🔍

The ghost outfit in the photos is what I wore yesterday.

caption:
One thing that is so liberating for me growing older and getting to know myself better is that I don’t care how people look at me when I walk down the street. 

I am part of my own runway and I wear what makes me feel good on a daily basis. 

Me myself and I are the stylist and together with the mood of the day puts together an outfit. 

I love what I wear and I wear it with pride and it just feels so liberating and fun. 

I feel so much better when I love my outfit. It is my armour of the day. 

I used to look at envy with those who had the courage to have a personal style. One day I just decided that that can be me too. 

I started buying more clothes second hand and noticed that I felt so much better when I wore really colourful clothes. So here I am owning my own style and not caring if other people think it is too much. It might be for someone but certainly not for me! 🌈

You can start today! What clothes in your wardrobe sparks extra joy for you? It is the sequins? The brown suit? The lace dress in white? The knitted rainbow cardigan? Start wearing more of those then and when you go to a second hand store to buy new clothes make them match the things in your wardrobe that sparks extra joy for you ❤️

I hope you will have a magical Sunday ❤️

Yesterdays outfit: 
💚 blazer from @myrorna 
🩵 dress from @sellpy

Many influencers I follow here on IG are last days talking about the transition of autumn into summer, which to me feels a little provocative when they are living in climates with higher temperatures atm than the warmest summer day in Sweden this year. 
Today and tomorrow promises with 24°C-26°C  to be one of the warmest this July-August in my place and therefor I don't want to talk Autumn yet. I chose a white skirt today and added a dress as a light coat. 
The whole outfit is secondhand except for the bag.

#secondhandfashion #secondhandiförstahand #secondhandfirst #prelovedfashion #makesecondhandyourfirstchoice

Want to know a secret about this outfit? 🔎

The only thing bought second hand is the (barely visible) necklace from @rodakorsetmariatorget 
Everything else was bought at various fast-fashion chains. The blazer is the most recent purchase, and was bought mid-summer 2022. Why am I telling you this? Because I think it is important to know that you can start your sustainable fashion journey at any point in your life. I only went 100% second hand as of 2023, before that I bought some clothes new and others from second hand. But since I discovered that I can find everything I need second hand, and I also find it a much more fun and relaxing way to shop, I decided to stop shopping at other stores all together. And it has worked really well so far. 

Does that mean that I have to throw away all of my clothes that weren’t bought second hand? No! That would be wasteful. The most sustainable clothes are the ones we already own, we just have to find new and better ways to use them instead of buying new things all the time. 

Are you buying second hand first? ♻️ 

_________________________________________

Monday morning and the weather is nice!
@reinventionfashionist and I discussed the other day why we as fashion- and vintageinterests since we were youngsters in our midfourties are moving from a more ecclectic and retro style to modern. We both noticed we'd circulated further beautiful vintage pieces that we didn't wear anymore. I'll show some of my sold items in stories later today. I'm still looking for high quality vintage pieces (classic items can also be vintage) and they can be quite bold, but I'm leaning more to the 90's nowadays and, most important, I'm often sizing up. This crochet 70's vest still works for me if I combine it with  feminine and classic items. No retrofeeling here. No vintage style (hopefully).

The whole outfit is vintage/secondhand except for the bag and ring.

#secondhandfashion
#secondhandfirst
#secondhandinspo #secondhandiförstahand #prelovedfashion #makesecondhandyourfirstchoice

Late summer I'm always returning to Stella Jean for inspiration. Today it was the combination of batik & leather from SS18 that caught my eye. 
This secondhand viscose skirt needs good ironing before wearing (steaming isn't sufficient) as viscose and lyocell fabrics do and I think that maybe the reason that the former owner did clean it out. It was in an all over wrinkled state when I bought it, but  ironing made all the difference.

The whole outfit is secondhand except for the bag.

10K! Wohoo and thank you so much ❤️

It’s been standing there for some days now but I patiently have been waiting to see if it will go down but I think I am finally here. ❤️

Thank you so much for wanting to be here with me and for all the love and kindness you spread. ❤️

This started as a covid account where I shared my outfits but never in a million years would I have thought that it would bring me friends from all over the world. And such kind and supportive friends. I am so greatful ❤️

When I hang out here with you I get this amazing energy and it is so refreshing to hang out with people who genuinely straight other peoples crowns up and who want good things to happened to others. ❤️

I hope you will have an amazing day and thank you so much again. ❤️

A white skirt it is today! For weeks I was looking at a white poplin skirt at @kappahl, but finally decided that I couldn't justify bying it (I can't keep any clothes white for longer than an hour 😉). I then noticed this Zara-skirt from last year at Sellpy, but hesitated for a week or so to order due to the noted 'stain'. Happy I gave it a try, bc the stain was not disturbing at all (see stories). Inspired by @gertivanlier the other day, I combined the skirt with a cashmere sweater and a pop of red. 

The whole outfit is secondhand.  Cashmere sweater HM premium, shoes Massimo Dutti, vintage wooden bracelet, my son's secondhand shirt jacket from Weekday

Can't we just continue this summer life? 
Sunny weather (21-24°C) and blue skies but quite cold nights (14-16°C =good night sleep!) and some rain every 3rd-4th day make the perfect summer climate for me without AC. I can read a book in the sun on the beach, paint a window, go sightseeing, go for a walk or a bike tour, choose a workout in the shadow or go rollerblading.

This secondhand wrap cupro skirt recently caught my eye because it gave me some Prada-vibes (see stories). 

Secondhand linen shirt and cupro skirt. My old Ecco mules...

#secondhandfashion
#secondhandinspo #secondhandfirst #secondhandiförstahand #outfitoftheday #prelovedfashion

And the blackberries gave me classic summer legs the other day. Somehow the largest berries are always just 50 cm further in.  Also bumped into the bike pedal when I lifted my bike earlier today...

Here is an really easy lace skirt remake. 

I used the left over curtain fabric that I took the ruffles from for another project. 

I used the existing channels and put an elastic band in both channels. 

I then measured how long I wanted the skirt to be and cut off the extra fabric. 

This is an easy fabric because you don’t have to zigzag the edges. It took just one seam and then it was ready. 

I hope you liked the video and how the skirt turned out. ❤️

#secondhandfashion #secondhandiförstahand #secondhandfirst #makesecondhandyourfirstchoice #prelovedfashion

Hoppas ingen har missat Vintagegarderoben hemma hos @klenodeer 🎀 Det här är en garderob av unika second hand och vintagekläder du inte vill missa och du kommer absolut bli ännu mer besatt av rosetter efter att ha inspirerats av Ebbas otroliga stil! Länk till youtubeavsnittet finns i bio och i story!

#vintagegarderoben

Vi är mitt i Black Week och uppmanas att konsumera mer än någonsin med hjälp av en massa olika rabatter och erbjudanden. Jag älskar mode och vill verkligen inspirera till att välja vintage, unika plagg som är minst 20 år gamla och gör minimal påverkan på 🌏. Kika gärna på min YouTube-video där jag visar 4 av mina favorit vintagebutiker i Stockholm. Det är såklart lättare sagt än gjort att bara handla preloved med genom att försöka välja second hand och framförallt vintage och minska inköpen av nyproducerad fast fashion gör vi gemensamt en insats för en mer hållbar framtid och modeindustri. 🎥 Länk i bio! 

#vintageshops #vintage #vintagelover #vintagestockholm #vintagefashion #vintagestyles #vintageclothing #vintagekleding #vintagestyling #fashioninspo

#vintagedress #vintagestyle #vintage80s #vintagefashion #myrorna #vintagewinter #bows #bowseason #bowbowbow #80sdress

#vintagewinter #winterwonderland

Paljetter! Det finns så otroligt mycket fina plagg med paljetter och pärlor second hand & vintage. 🪩
Samarbetet mellan H&M x Rabanne har nog inte undgått någon och paljettrenden som ofta smyger sig tillbaka varje höst och vinter inför festligheter är kanske större än någonsin. Någon som är grym på att använda vintageplagg i paljetter året om att inspireras av är @theresaaxostyle ✨

Jag föll för den här jackan hos @beyondretro just för att den ser ut lite som en kavaj med de silvriga detaljerna. Lyxigt silke och t.o.m är originallappen kvar med extra paljetter. Tips är verkligen att spana in @beyondretronordics de har oftast fina paljettplagg inne! 

Tänker du bära paljetter #aw23?

#vintage #vintagesequins #sequins #beyondretro #paljetter #sequinjacket #preloved #partyseason #vintagekläder #partyseason #sequin #vintagekleding #vintageklær #vintagestyles #vintagenerd #hållbartmode #slowfashion #vintagelover #aw23 #rabanne #vintageclothing #secondhandfirst #prelovedfashion

I sann anti Black Friday-anda tänkte jag visa er mina 4 absolut bästa vintagebutiker i Stockholm! 🎥 Länk till YouTube-videon i bio!

Nu när Black Week snart drar igång och vi uppmanas att konsumera mer än vad vi vanligtvis gör med hjälp av en massa olika rabatter och erbjudanden.. Jag älskar mode och vill verkligen inspirera till att välja vintage, unika plagg som är minst 20 år gamla och gör minimal påverkan på 🌏. Det är såklart lättare sagt än gjort men genom att försöka välja second hand och framförallt vintage och minska inköpen av nyproducerad fast fashion gör vi gemensamt en insats för en mer hållbar framtid och modeindustri. 

Stockholm är fyllt med fantastiska second hand- och vintagebutiker, och i denna video kommer jag att guida er genom mina fyra favoritbutiker som jag anser vara ett måste för alla som besöker staden. Dessa butiker erbjuder kuraterade samlingar av vintagekläder, skor och accessoarer. 

#wearyourvalues #vintage #vintageshops #vintagestyle #stockholm #stockholmvintage #vintagekläder #vintagebutik #hållbartmode #stockholmsweden #vintagelove #vintagelover #vintageshopping #vintagehunting #thrifthunter

Det här med att man (tillslut) kan hitta allt vintage…. Det har visat sig ännu en gång vara sant! #slowfashion kräver tålamod men det blir så mycket roligare och unikt. Fördelarna är många! Det kan inte bara vart jag som suktade efter den grönblå #balenciaga kappan för något år sedan och sparade ner inspobilder på #pinterestboard 💚 Nu hittade jag den här gröna #vintagekappan från Malung på @tradera som jag tycker va i perfekt #60-talsmodell också. Vad tror du? Vilket årtionde? Kan det vara 60-70tal?

Dressed for a meeting at another hospital first thing in the morning in an outfit inspired by Prada SS24, combining a distressed and oversized chore jacket with a feminine skirt and pointy heels. 
I already bought this mended vintage LL.Bean jacket a few days after the Prada SS24 show last Autum.  It's been repaired and cleaned by a little company specifically mending LL.Bean (Unfortunately, I didn't save the tag). This company  really was ahead, even of Prada! 
Ofcourse, as expected, Prada-inspired chore jackets are popping up everywhere on the high street atm. 
I'm happy with my vintage chore jacket (one newly produced does have as much environmental impact as 250 secondhand jackets), but I'm looking with a little envy at the leather collar of the jacket from COS...

#secondhandfashion #secondhandinspo #secondhandiförstahand #secondhandfirst #prelovedfashion #makesecondhandyourfirstchoice #vintagellbean

@a.vestergren postade på story att hon provat den här vintageklänningen på @myrornagotgatan för någon dag sen men att den tyvärr va i fel strl så hon lämnade kvar den. Jag gick dit dagen efter lyckades knipa den här fantastiska #80tal (borde de va eller hur?) långklänningen med roliga cutouts och rosettdetaljer på knappar och låtsasfickor. Tänker att den blir perfekt som klänning med sandaletter och röda läppar.. men också kul att styla såhär över #70sjeans och rosett i håret. 🎀

I hardly ever try outfits in advance, so things sometimes will turn out differently from expected, while time is running out in the morning. This outfit is way too "matchy".
I didn't feel comfortable at all in this vintage yellow coat I bought for 40 SEK last Winter after I'd seen the Altazurra SS24 show and all the yellow hues during the fashion weeks for spring. 
A cognac leather bomber would have been better. 

New chances tomorrow....

The whole outfit is vintage/secondhand.

#secondhandfashion #secondhandiförstahand #secondhandfirst #prelovedfashion

After rain comes sunshine...

The whole outfit is secondhand except for the denim blazer (Mango). 

Started to miss my wardrobe this morning, longing for one of my longarmed linen shirts and/or my unlined taupe blazer, which would have been perfect with this dress today. Also miss my yellow linen skirt and a simple grey cashmere cardi. I'm not a fan of the limitations of a travel wardrobe more than for 5-6 days. The weather forecast was a bit colder than turned out, so I packed too heavy pieces that will not be used as frequently as expected (or not att all), like this denim blazer, my burgundy LL.Bean canvas coat and my long wide jeans. But last year it was the other way around, so I felt I had to prepare for colder weather this year.

#secondhandfashion #secondhandiförstahand #secondhandfirst #prelovedfashion #makesecondhandyourfirstchoice

Senaste dagarna i 📸-rullen!

1: #70s kragar är det bästa jag vet. Letar alltid efter det på #secondhand och #vintage Den här med broderi på köpte jag i en vintagebutik i Nice. 
2: Lyssnade på @billgrenwoodpodcast avsnitt om höstmode och blev peppad på att klä mig i materialmixen med spetsbyxor och stickad tröja. Älskar också fina golv #inspirationiseverywhere 
3: Kan aldrig motstå att fota solrosor, här på helgjobb på Siggesta gård
4: Lackväska! Höstens vintageväska som jag fyndade redan förra året hos @stockholmsstadsmission 
5: Materialmix med skinn, lack och stickad tröja. Sensommar!
6: Gulliga får på Siggesta Gård
7: Påbörjat ett vintagemönster. 
7: Frukost in heaven.. persikor, ricotta, krasse och pistage @cafepomflora bästa stället!

I have always expressed myself with my style and clothes has always been important to me. In this post we revisit my teen era. 

Music defined me in my teens and I knew everything about my favourite musicians. I also picked out the album cover and learnt all lyrics by heart. 
Here are some more music facts for you 🎶 

1. I have two tattoos inspired by my favourite band the smashing pumpkins. 

2. My style icons growing up was: Debbie Harry, Shirley Manson, Gwen Stefani, D’arcy

3. I used to create mixed tapes with songs from the radio. We also swapped tapes with eachother. Bandit 105,5 rock ❤️

4. I won tickets to a No Doubt show by phoning a radio station and singing No Doubts Hey You. 

5. I knew all the lines to the movie Empire Records because it was me and my friends favourite movie and we wanted to work in a record store. 

7. Here are some bands I have seen live:,Placebo, Smashing Pumpkins, Radiohead, Foo Fighters, hole, Ash, Weezer, the Hives, blur, magic numbers, the wannadies, Kent, the cure, muse

8. I was at Holes show at the Hultsfred festival and a young woman died in the audience at this show. 

9. I’ve been to these festivals: Arvika, Hultsfred, Roskilde, Fanclub, Where the action is. 

10. M-tv played the best music at night with Alternative Nation and Superrock. I used to stay up and watch those shows. 

Have clothes always been important to you? What did you listen to in your teens?

💜 bag a gift from my hubby from @sellpy 
💚 skirt from @sellpy 
💜 vintage top from @myrorna 
🖤 hat @hericane_thelabel 
🖤 sandals from @tamaris_official

Woke up with a big need to be creative. 

Went to my local charity shop to find some fabric. I found an old curtain with a ruffle and I could see a top in my head. I also found some things for another project. 

When I got home I moved the sewing machine outside and also a TV so I could watch the Olympics. 

I made the top and I am really Happy with the result. I Will share it tomorrow. 

Today I might start with the other project. ☺️

I hope you will have a fantastic thursday.

Call me the fabric whisperer! Or maby the curtain whisperer 😂

When I look at fabric at charity shops it has to speak to me in some way. If I had found this curtain as just fabric I would not have made this top. 
The ruffle is what made me buy it. And it was not a lot of fabric so I could only make a small top. Since my sewing skills are limited I have to find creative ways to close the garments I make. (No zippers or buttons just yet) Here I went with ribbons. 

I loved making the ribbons. I used a part of fabric that was left from the top. I folded them and used an iron to make them stay folded so I could sew them. 

I am really happy with the result and I hope you like it too! 💚💙💚

I found the curtain at my local charity shop @rodakorsetsecondhand 

 My sewing machine is a Singer Simple 3223 @singer_sverige 

Happy friday all you lovely people in this corner of Instagram 🩷

Allt blir roligare med en 🎀, right? Såg @fannyekstrand ha en stor organza rosett i håret och sett mycket rosetter när jag scrollat hösttrender.

Första gången jag sydde en rosett, det var ju faktiskt inte så svårt.

Såhär gjorde jag:

1: Jag klippte i dubbelt tyg då jag använde ett tunnare tyg. Klippte 60x30cm. Då blir rosetten ca 25x12cm när den är klar.
2: Vek tygbiten dubbelt och sydde ihop långsidan. Vände ut och in och sydde sen ihop sidorna. 
3: Sen till det lite trixiga att förklara, vik in sidorna, överlappa 1 cm på mitten så att du kan sy genom alla tre lager på mitten. Jag sydde den här för hand för att kunna dra ihop/rynka ihop rosetten på mitten.
4: Sy mittenbiten, ringen som som håller ihop rosetten. Jag klippte dubbelt tyg 9x6cm. Sydde ihop långsidan som en tub, vänd ut och in så alla sömmar göms bakåt. Jag använde en vanlig hårnål sen för att fästa den i håret.

I got some new followers so I thought it was a good idea to get to know me better.  Here are 10 random questions I found online. ☺️

What’s your favorite way to spend a weekend?
Charge my batteries, sometimes with friends and family and sometimes I need to be alone. 

What’s your dream job?
I have always wanted to be a designer.

Do you have any siblings?
I am the eldest of three daughters. My sisters names are Kristin and Kerstin. ❤️

What kind of music do you enjoy?
I am an alternative rock chick but turning more and more into “a good tune is a good tune.” And the best songs are the ones you can sing along to. 🎶 

Where have you always wanted to travel to?
USA 🇺🇸 

What’s a skill you’re proud of?
My creativity ❤️

What’s your idea of a perfect vacation?
Visiting a new town and walking around looking at old beautiful buildings. Visiting thrift stores and staying at a hotel where I can enjoy a good breakfast. 

Do you have any favorite TV shows or movies?
Favourite movies: virgin suicides, Harry Potter, LOTR, Jane Austen movies. 
Tv shows: twin peaks, stranger things, 

What do you wish you had more time to do?
Paint and draw. ✍️ 🎨 

What’s something you love learning about? 
I am so curious by nature so I love learning new things. 

Please tell me something about yourself. Do we have anything in common? 

I also want to thank you for being here ❤️

One of the reasons why it is important for me to get dressed everyday is to celebrate the body that I have. 

I feel so much better when I get dressed. Here is a list of small acts that have helped me to be kinder to my body: 

- I never buy clothes that don’t fit the body I have now.

- I follow accounts that are body positive because we come in all shapes and form and we are all beautiful. 

- I don’t compare myself to others because my body is unique and what I got, so I work with it not against it. 

- I can’t follow accounts that talk about losing weight and getting skinnier because that makes me question if these are things I should do too and it makes me question my body. This is something individual off course but for me it is not a good option. 

- thrifting means finding unique pieces and of the clothes don’t fit I think: I wish it was larger so it would fit me. I don’t think I wish I was skinnier so I would fit in it. 

- I battle unkind thoughts about my body and am reprogramming my brain to find beauty in what the beauty industry wants us to hate about our body’s. 

- I am ageing so is my body. So I try to embrace the changes and learn to love them instead of seeing them as flaws. 

What do you do to be kind to yourself and your body?

I hope you will have an amazing day and remember that you are beautiful and unique ❤️

Why I choose second hand first? 

- because of the environment. 🌏 
There are already so much clothes produced to last for the six coming generations. Fast fashion is one of the worst environmental bad guys letting go of all that emission. And we don’t even sell all the clothes that’s been produced. The clothes that are sent back are thrown away and end up in a dessert somewhere. Fast fashion companies are also destroying the land that their factory is at by the strong chemicals they use for colouring and so on. 

- because of human rights - ethical reasons. ❤️
The people who make the clothes for fast fashion companies don’t even have a living wage. They have horrible working conditions and are abused. Women who work don’t use the restroom because they are afraid of being raped. They work long hours and still can’t afford a house, food and medical help. They are the modern slaves and this has to stop. The fast fashion companies makes so much money. I know they offer a lot of money to influencers so why don’t they use all that money to raise the wages for their workers? I have been offered 1000 dollars by posts from some companies and they are villing to send me a lot of clothes. Swipe for screenshot of two of the mails. 

- because of creative and personal reasons. 🌈
I love searching for treasures in thrift stores and I love how it has developed my style. It is a creative process and I feel amazing. So my style has actually made me feel better. I love searching for unique pieces. 

Why do you choose second hand first? 

I hope you will have an amazing Monday! ❤️

Spent another day at the amazing Gripsholms castle. 
In 1537 they started building this castle. It was Gustav Vasa who wanted it to be built. Now the castle holds the largest collection of portraits and the famous stuffed animal -  Leo the lion. 

1. Me at the castle in front of some of the paintings. 
2. Walking in to the first court yard. 
3. One of the towers - the Vasa tower.
4. Mandatory group shot in front of pointing picture. 
5. The castle through a window. 
6. Group shot in old mirror. 
7. The famous stuffed animal - Leo the Lion, he has his own merch. 
8. Peter and his doppelganger 
9. Waiting for the others. 
10. One of my favourite paintings at the castle. 

This is just one of the royal castle you can visit when you are in Sweden @kungligaslotten 

I hope you will have an amazing Friday.❤️

Har vi verkligen gett tillräckligt mycket kärlek till #Gucci Jackie 1961 väskan?

The story goes that in 1964, three years after the Constance (as the bag first named) was first released, Kennedy Onassis wandered into a Gucci boutique and left with six of the crescent-shaped bags. From then on, she was rarely photographed without one tucked under her arm, popularising the style and prompting the Gucci house to change the Constance’s name to ‘the Jackie’.

🐚 Blev kär i detta italienska vintage halsband på @vestiaireco från Ugo Correani och läste på lite då jag inte hört namnet innan. 

Ugo Correani is one of fashion jewelry's best-kept secrets. For two decades, starting in 1973, the Rome-born designer worked behind the scenes from his humble Milan atelier for some of the industry's biggest names, including Chanel, Versace, Valentino and Christian Lacroix.

So I saw this reel where the clothes flew in and then got attached to the person. I saved it and thought about how I could create something similar. Love a creative challenge! 

I first tried to do an overlay in CapeCut but you had to have a pay version to use the effect that I wanted to use. 

I then tried it in Pics Art and I found that when I added a photo and removed the background I could create an effect and make the piece of clothing “fly”. 

The film is a really long clip of me standing in the same place and adding on layers. 

Start the camera.
Stand still.
Reach for the blouse and try not to move my feet and then put it on.
Stand still for a while. 
Reach for the skirt and put it on. Stand still for a while and so on. 

The total clip of my doing this is 3 minutes and 8 seconds. I then made that long clip in to short clips that I wanted to use. 

I first tried filming the objects and then adding them. In capecut you can remove the background on film but I couldn’t get it to remove and keep the right pieces. In Picsart I couldn’t remove the backgrounds on films but on photos. So I took seperate photos of all the items and then added them to the clip where I wanted them. I then put them all togeather and made this 10 second short clip. 

I really hope you like it. ❤️

I love that it is unique and I love to think about how it end up in Sweden? Did someone go on Holliday and bought it there or was it a gift? 

I love the flower print and the bright colours. 

It is bought from the lovely Linda who has @goodoldvintage_shop 

I hope you will have an amazing Friday. ❤️

If you take the old way from Södertälje to Mariefred you will pass by Qvartinge antik. @qvartingeantik 
It is a big barn who has antiquates and second hand on two floors. 
They have most home decor and furniture but also some clothes, books and other stuff. 

They are open Saturday and Sunday 11-15

We make at least one visit her a year. I just love going through all their treasures. 

They also have a cafe. 
You can’t bring dogs or a stroller here. 

You don’t have to buy new. It is way more personal to find your indoor decorations second hand. ❤️

Do you buy things for your home second hand?

My feed before and after the 10th of may. 

I just had to make this reel Since it looks like I am living in my hat but I am here to let you know this and contradict some of the rumours going around: 

- no I don’t sleep with the hat on. 
- people have seen me leave my house without the hat but they just haven’t got any good photos of it. 
- I didn’t cry when the hat blew off my head and almost ended up on the car road, it was just a strong wind tearing up my eyes. 
- I haven’t written a love song to the hat. 
- the hat doesn’t watch TV with me. 
- I haven’t named the hat cuz there is not a perfect name for such a perfect hat not because I don’t want to 😂
- the hat hasn’t had any effect on my sense of humour it is just as bad as ever 😂

I hope you appreciate my bad sense of humour and enjoy my new hat approved feed. 

Happy Sunday all you lovely people. ❤️

The hat is from @hericane_thelabel 
The dress is vintage and from the Swedish label Magna. 

#hericanethelabel #funnyhaha #myfeed #vintageiförstahand #506070tal #506070talskläder #dagensvintageoutfit #dagensvintage

I made another dress out of old curtains I found at a charity shop. 

To make the top I used @stinaloving Tiger top and shortened it a bit. The skirt is a full length curtain shortened 20 cm. The 20 cm long pice I used to make into the ribbon. I used the left over fabric to make sleeves. 

I just love how it turned out! ❤️
What do you think? ❤️

Old friends from last autumn/winter❣️

The temperature has dropped in the UK and suddenly ads are popping up telling me about the autumn outfits that (!) I absolutely must have (!).

This post is a reminder to myself of all the old favourites that I’ve enjoyed wearing in the colder months before, and will do again. I hope it’s also a source of inspiration for you too, that before you think about buying something for your autumn/winter wardrobe, (new or second-hand) you: 

(1) look at what you wore last year (and the years before), to ensure your reliably informed about what really is missing (or what will properly enhance) your wardrobe. Hint, it might be something practical first before you delve into a brand new colour palette!

(2) remember that the weather looks alright next week and you probably don’t need to get a new wool coat just yet. Your summer clothes might have some legs left in them!

#secondhand #secondhandstyle #sustainablestyle #slowfashion #slowfashionblogger #secondhandseptember #autumnfashion autumn winter fashion outfits

Alternative ideas on how to get involved in Second Hand September, for both the first timers and the expert thrifters 🫶 Save for the month ahead!

Second Hand September was launched by @oxfamgb back in 2019. It’s a campaign that seeks to encourage people to buy only second-hand items for one month. It’s a great opportunity to try out second-hand for the first time or refocus your efforts and reflect on your existing shopping habits. Whether you pledge to take part for the whole month or give second-hand a go just once, you’d become part of a growing movement of people shopping preloved over new. 

I’ll be sharing tips all month, so follow for more, but here’s some ideas to get started for the first time thrifters and the experts among us! 

Please do share your ideas in the comments too and let me know if you’re planning to take part 🤝

#SecondHandSeptember slow fashion #secondhandstyle fashion blogger #sustainablefashion #sustainability

Would you buy second-hand sportswear? 🚴‍♀️🌍 

If you do or don’t, let me know why! I’ll buy lightly worn gym kit second-hand, but when it comes to cycle gear, I’ll typically only buy it new with tags, depending on the item. The secondary market is full of sport kit that’s new with tags (missed returns, unwanted gifts, leaving a sport? I’m unsure!) and we might as well make the most of that instead of buying new 🤝 

#slowfashion #sustainable #secondhandseptember #sustainablesport #sustainablesportswear #sustainablecycling #cyclingkit #cycling #cyclinglife cycling sportswear sustainability

My local mind was doing Fill A Bag for just £2.00 and here is what I found! 👀

I love things like this as I would much prefer the shop sells items at a low price rather than sending items to rag. With more and more clothes getting donated, the charity shops can’t handle the volume of stock. I think bargain bags, £1 rails and fill a bag events will become more common as the volume of donations continues to rise. I am all for sales if it stops items heading to landfill! 🤩

As donors we must be more conscious about what we are donating and check the items are in sellable condition before we take them to the shops. Oh and remember to gift aid if you are a taxpayer. Times are tight and every little helps! 🥰
