A dream dress ☁️

This weekend I stopped at my parent's house in Manchester, and made an obligatory visit to @noodboutique in Chorlton. The shop is a small independent boutique, stocking a hand picked selection of timeless pieces, all of which align to their ethical and sustainable values. It's a lovely shop, and such a pleasure to take your time trying on and browsing in there.

I often talk about the different ways there are to 'do' slow fashion, and one of them, I believe, is to buy new, but slowly and thoughtfully. My Mum has a small curated wardrobe of high quality pieces, and only adds a small amount to that each year. Compared to my usual second hand shopping habits, my Mum's consumption of fashion is much more thought-through. It teaches me to always re-evaluate if I should add more clothes to my wardrobe. 

@noodboutique is one of my Mum's favourites, so I've recently started stopping by whenever I've visited home. This time I found this shirred maxi dress, having seen my Mum wearing it in another colour. I've been searching for a sleeper, maxi, shirred, puff sleeved dress for a while on the second hand sites, and to no avail. I even ordered one, and when the sizing came up wrong, resold it. This dress fits so well, and would be great to wear throughout the year. The brand is @sugarhillbrighton, and after doing some research pre-purchase, I found that 10% of their profits go to charity organisations, their productions are kept small, and all their suppliers are signed up to the Ethical Trading Initiative. These are a couple of reasons why buying new from this brand worked for me! 

After a couple of purchases recently, it'll be a no-buy month or a few for me! 

Outfit~
Dress: @sugarhillbrighton via @noodboutique 
Boots: 1 year old
Coat: @depop

Well it’s 1st November and time for @slowfashionchallenge , day 1, introduction. 
I recently did an intro for something else so apologies if I am repeating myself.
My name is Marcia, I’m 72 years old and my day job is running my antique shop, Smoking Monkey Antiques in Suffolk.
I make most of my clothes using old textiles and what I don’t make I generally buy secondhand. I personally think the best way to avoid being dragged into the fast fashion world is to develop your own style rather than follow trends…plus this way is considerably more fun.
Slow fashion is something I feel very strongly about for many reasons. The pollution and waste produced by the fast fashion industry is totally unacceptable. These huge issues can seem overwhelming but I think we have to consider the phrase “think globally, act locally”. None of us can take on all the problems in the world but we can change the way we behave and encourage others to do the same. 
With this in mind some friends and I have recently started an instagram community called @curtainstocouture . The aim is to encourage a community that stitches using reclaimed fabrics, slowing down and breathing life into old textiles.
I think it’s important not to guilt trip but to encourage by example and most importantly learn from one another.
This coat dress is one of my favourite patterns from the Japanese sewing book Stylish Wraps, it is made from five thrifted cafe tablecloths. I made the frock from a 1970s cotton twill bought from a friend. The necklaces, earrings, tee shirt and bag are all thrifted.

Summer in vintage, second hand and new 🌻

You don't have to be perfect to be more sustainable.

 I wonder if people would try out sustainable and second hand fashion more if they didn't feel the pressure to be perfect. We're often pushed to take an all or nothing approach to our lifestyle choices, but it's important to recognise that the small changes do count. 

I remember this more whenever I wear an outfit that's sustainable in different ways. These shorts are a vintage find from last year, the top an old second hand piece, and the hat bought new a few weeks ago. Who knew bucket hats came in small, medium and large, and that my head wouldn't necessarily fit all hats? 😬 Being able to pop into a shop and try on meant I just bought one hat, once, and not a couple of second hand hats, to later resell or donate because they didn't fit.

If you buy all new, and one piece second hand, or all new, but have a small, curated wardrobe, or enjoy regular charity shop hauls, you're always doing something to reimagine your clothing consumption habits. There's time here for all of those, and they should all be celebrated!

Outfit~

I may not leave my house/garden much but fashion connects me in so many ways globally. And I’m so thankful for that 🌎 

Ok Australia I see you producing the talent with so many indie sustainable ethical designers! 
And the secondhand gods shone down upon me when I found this incredible @lornamurray_ sun hat online. I love it so much. Teamed with a jumpsuit from the epic @obusclothing also Australian who do fabulous patterns and SO much colour! 

Then off to the USA for my next two faves! My beloved lil neon pink 👁️ purse from @minandmonbags in NYC and you know how much I love @charlottestoneshoes they just make the most colourful shoes ever! Lil dopamine hits for feets. 

Then a fellow Northerner in the U.K. by chum Lyndsay @neowalksticks makes all my fabulous walking stick which have truly become part of my fashion ensemble! 

Necklace, rings & sunnies all secondhand

A lot of people would be surprised by how easy it is to shop secondhand, either from charity shops, vintage shops or online, there’s so much great stuff out there, barely worn and stylish. If you can’t find what you need secondhand, shop from the vast number of amazing sustainable brands available now 🌿

The real moto here though, is to shop less and be more mindful - think about how much wear you’ll get from that piece, what is made of (favour natural materials) and if you really want it or you’re just falling for a marketing trick, because if you love your clothes you’ll cherish them and they’ll last longer, resulting in a much more sustainable way to consume fashion.

Do you in fact NEED this coat?

#AutisticStimming 

For as long as I can remember I’ve been obsessed with curtain tassels. With alll tassels and fringing. If I see it, I gotta touch it. I’m very much a tactile sensory seeker with almost all fabrics but the pattern spotters amongst you will  have noticed how often I’ve worn curtain tassels as necklaces over the years.  They are a kind of stim toy for me, something I use to fidget with to help regulate myself when I need too or for joy. 

I also use finger movements to stim but as this made me feel like I stood out more I learned to replace it publicly with items like this. Or pieces I kept in my pockets that I liked to rub or sniff if nobody was looking ☺️

Do you have a favourite stim toy? Recommendations for tactile ones greatly appreciated? 

image description: a series of images of rue serving fabulous looks that all incorporate curtain tassels, tassels or fringing.

#TheVintageFashionChallenge2024 

Todays prompt is working hard
 So I’ve giving kudos to this ol’ workhorse of a dress from late 30s to early 40s that I’ve been wearing for nearly 9 years and  is the ultimate #sustainablefashion garment. It’s made of cotton, zip front, has pockets & is super comfortable to wear & has been wearable through fluctuating weight. It’s not one I’ve ever styled much just choosing to wear as it and I tend to wear it out and about to antique fairs and such in summer. It’s never needed a repair so far  and is still in fabulous condition. I hope it lasts another (nearly) 100 years.

#truevintageootd #thevintagefashionchallenge #dopaminedressing #proudoutfitrepeater #rewearyourwardrobe #shopsecondhand #vintagefashion #sustainableclothing #sustainablestyle #babewithamobilityaid #disabilityrepresentationinfashion #disabilityfashion

Here are 5 questions that you should ask yourself before you shop for clothes, to become a more responsible and mindful shopper.

1 - Is this an impulse buy? Buying something just on a whim, without giving it a second thought, usually results in Buyer’s remorse, making them feel guilty about their purchase.

2 - Is it ethically made? Suspiciously low prices are liked because someone else is paying the price. Most likely, the workers who made your clothes are being exploited and/or the materials used are cheap and a burden on the environment.

3 - How long will it last? Opt for garments that endure over time, resisting the temptation of low-quality items that seem affordable but quickly wear out.

4 - Can I buy this secondhand? Thrifting can benefit you and the environment in a big way, despite your lifestyle. You’ll always find great deals for high-quality clothing from brand names that you already know and trust if you opt to thrift.

5 -  Will I still want this next season? If we follow fashion trends and always buy clothes that are trending at the moment, we end up discarding clothes every season, having to recreate our whole wardrobe again and again.

Remember, being a mindful shopper doesn’t have to be challenging. Each purchase, no matter how small, carries significant impact 🌍 #sustainabilityuk #sustainablefashion #sustyvibes #sustainableclothing

What is an  #AmbulatoryWheelchairUser ? ♿️

I am! I can move my legs & I walk short distances on flat surfaces. I can stand briefly in my heels. I use an electric wheelchair. I use walking sticks. I use a rollator. I use a stair lift. I use an all terrain wheelchair because I live in a mountain range. It be heckin’ hilly. 

I’m also #autistic. I wore each of these epic outfits briefly today for some #dopaminedressing and to indulge in the #autisticjoy of my #specialistinterest. Then I was back into soft, baggy, cotton tee and big knickers with nothing else touching me for the comfort ☺️ 

Tomorrow I will rest as part of #pacing for my #chronicillness

#visabilityfordisability #disabledrepresentation #disabilityawareness #secondhandfashion #secondhandstyle #babewithamobilityaid #differentaidsfordifferentdays #disability #disabled #fashion #disabledfashion #disabledcontentcreator

Repeat with me: sustainable fashion is not expensive! And trying to excuse your need for “trendy” clothes at the cost of someone else’s welfare is just vile. While it’s true that some sustainable brands may have higher prices due to the cost of using eco-friendly materials or ethical production practices, there are many ways to make sustainable fashion accessible to EVERYONE.

Firstly, shopping second-hand is a great way to embrace sustainable fashion at a very accessible cost. Many second-hand stores even offer online shopping options, making it easier to access sustainable fashion. I love @thrift_plus_uk @reliked @oxfamgb and @prewornltd but let’s not forget @depop @vinted and @ebay_uk 🖤

Another way to make sustainable fashion affordable is to choose versatile, high-quality pieces that will last a long time. Investing in well-made clothing that can be worn in different ways and for different occasions can actually save money in the long run, as you won’t need to constantly replace low-quality, fast-fashion items. 

Sustainable fashion is NOT about buying eco-friendly clothing, but also about reducing overall consumption and waste. By making intentional choices about what you buy and how you wear it, you can make a big impact on both your wallet and the environment 🌿✨🤍

#sustainablefashion #slowfashion #boycottfastfashion #fashionrevolution #whomademyclothes

caption:
Thrifted tablescapes ALL THE WAY! 👏✨ you know what actually give me the ick? Viral Amazon homeware or anything labelled a must have for your home… the lack of individuality is not for me, not to mention shopping from companies that are one of the biggest contributors to climate change, of course 😏 

Comment below if you’re also a convert to the home section of charity shops! 🖤 #reducereuserecycle♻️ #ecofriendly #greenproducts #greenlifestyle #zerowasteliving #environmentallyfriendly #zerowaste #madetolast

caption:
You ever do a really dumb thing knowing full well at the time you’ll regret it but do it anyway…

Well here’s a pic of me wearing wearing a glorious gold secondhand gown after I had just crawled along the ground on my hands and knees and dragged myself back up into my wheelchair. 

Nope I didn’t fall out. I had one of those momentarily thoughts of “I’ll be fine” as I stood in those skyscraper heels to put my camera tripod in front of me to take my piccie. I was not fine. I can only stand briefly in those heels on flat surfaces. I went down like a sack of potatoes. But carried on anyway because I get sick of #ehlersdanlossyndrome danlos and other crap getting in my way 🤪

And today as I lie in bed thinking why is my shoulder blade falling out at the back after both my ankles have been killing me for days, my hip muscle kept giving way yesterday and both knees kept giving way as I lay in bed yesterday AND I have elbow pain, which is rarer for me so feels insulting. This is a lot more symptoms than I’m used to dealing with on the daily now with EDS. Then I saw this pic and last weekend came flooding back. 

Swipe for the pic of me today rueing the day I pulled a rue as I’ve done so many times before when I think ‘I’ll be ok’ arghhh. I will be, it’ll just take a minute. And welcome to a lesson for #ehlersdanlossyndromeawareness month. Protect your joints. Don’t do daft shit because it will be quicker and you can 🤣

Wait till my husband sees this and says “fuck sake Rue” and puts his hand to his head in loving exasperation!

Getting ready for a peacefully psychedelic sixties summer 🌸

Moving to the countryside was the best thing ever for my mental health. I don’t cope with people. We chose the least accessible house because it was high up a hill with no one out front so I had absolute peace. It was worth the trade off.

The truth is I can’t cope seeing anyone unexpectedly. Even if I know and like you. My body needs time to heal from the constant pain and stress it’s under and sitting out here alone is what works for me. And I’m really lucky to live here. 

Wearing the beautiful lily mini dress from @ninelivesbazaar_ look at these sleeves! 
Lilac tights @bettertights 
Rollator @byacre 

Image description: rue standing in her field using a mint rollator wearing a pastel golden and lilac sixties pattern mini dress with gorgeous big sleeves, lilac tights and yellow platform shoes. She is alone and at peace within the world. 

#dopaminedressing #vintagestyle #sixtiesstyle #vintagefashion #disabilityfashion #babewithamobilityaid #disabledinnature #disabilityawareness #chronicillness #rollator #differentaidsfordifferentdays

Just out here doing hot middle aged wifie disabled showgirls 💩

THIS is #NeurodivergentJoy 
Why do we set aside childish things we enjoy as we get older? 

I’ve been rekindling my joy for dress up box outfits. I would have loved to have been a dancer but #Dyspraxia & #mobilityissues said nope to that ever happening. So instead I’m out in my field having a wee one wifie rave with very little movement and all the joy.

Autism Assessment feedback came through - swipe for results 💖

I am super chuffed to have the confirmation of what I long suspected. I am indeed Autistic. Sweet timing for #AutismAcceptance month too. After 45 years I’m glad to finally know I do belong, I am like so many others who are different and I’m definitely not an alien or broken and it’s ok to just be myself.
And thanks to my fam who got me the best trophy certification of being a hand flapper made in advance as they all knew I’d be diagnosed 😆

Sign made by @resicraft_boutique #certifiedhandflapper

Secondhand Susty Queen 👑

Rewearing pieces because I’m a proud #OutfitRepeater I bought each of them secondhand but who knows how many people owned them before me. Do we have a term for that yet? 

I’m thrifty but not a thrifter as charity shops don’t tend to be accessible to me as a wheelchair user with no ramps and lack of space. 

I’m a vintage and antique hunter and love the huge indoor/outdoor markets selling troves of treasures. I can sniff a good  textile piece out amongst the jumble if it all. 

And I love modern too but prefer sustainable, ethical, small brand businesses with big hearts ♥️ 

But mostly I’m an online shopper. A bed dweller. Preferring to peruse your old stuff you no longer want through secondhand market places and put my pennies straight to your pocket and prevent clothing going to landfill which is where lots of donated clothes end up now. 

A #SustyFashion connoisseur

It’s a common misconception that pre-loved goods are worn-out or damaged. However, my personal experience has been quite the opposite.

I’ve delved into local charity shops, scoured platforms like Vinted, eBay, and Marketplace, and to my delight, stumbled upon items that were not just in great shape but also brand new. From toys to unique gifts, these places are like a goldmine waiting to be explored.

I encourage you to give them a chance – you might be pleasantly surprised at what you’ll find! Imagine stumbling upon that perfect gift or that one-of-a-kind item you’ve been seeking, all while reducing your environmental impact, not to mention the absolute bargains. It’s a win-win-win situation! So, join me in embracing sustainable shopping and discovering treasures that even Santa himself would approve of. 🌟🎁 

#SustainableFinds #SecondhandGems #UniqueGifts

AD* Ebay x Love Island launch lunch 💖

(*lunch paid for by Ebay)

It was such a pleasure to be invited to lunch with @ebay_uk last week for a first look at the preloved clothes heading into the Love Island villa for the second time.

The winter season aired last night and I was looking out for the four main wardrobe trends put together by Ebay’s preloved stylist, @amybannermanstylist , which we got to see during the lunch: Tutti Frutti (think dopamine dressing), Business V Party (tailoring meets glamour), Heavy Metal (leather jackets, studs and metallic colours) and Dressed-up Denim.

The success of last season’s preloved partnership was reflected in the number of people that searched for preloved clothing on Ebay: a 1600% increase from May-November 2022, based on Ebay’s search data. The scope of preloved clothes has expanded this season, with Ebay featuring for the first time its “imperfects” range of high street and luxury products and a selection of trainers that form part of Ebay’s designer authenticity guarantee programme. Ebay will even be re-using some clothes featured in the last season, a fun way to spot some previous iconic outfits as well as reinforcing rewearing. We also found out that swimwear will be sourced primarily from small and sustainable brands.

During the lunch we heard more about the partnership between Love Island and Ebay, the way in which clothes are selected, and an insight into fashion psychology with @shakailaelise .
 
The main takeaway for me was seeing that this partnership wasn’t just a one off and I’d be keen to see the momentum continue. I’d like to see more contestants forming partnerships with sustainable brands off the back of this show, Tasha Ghouri last series becoming the first Preloved Ambassador for eBay, more references to preloved fashion throughout the show (maybe a preloved styling challenge for contestants?) and more shows generally adopting preloved, upcycled and repaired fashion and homewares as the norm.

Thanks to @easypeasysustainability for the first photo 📷

#ebayxloveisland #prelovedfashion #loveisland #slowfashionblogger

Can you see Neurodivergence? 

Well the kids at school certainly seemed to. Some teachers & bosses who bullied me along the way too. People who have tried to what seems like ‘take me down a peg or two’ for my daring to be different knew. I think some people think I’m taking the piss when I don’t get it. Or ask questions. Which I do a lot and they see something. 

I’m clumsy, you could see it in how I walked before that became more impaired, I have sensory motor tics that are a big hand flap that end in a clap. There is no hiding that. I’m very light & noise sensitive and will react. Often & loudly about it. I get overwhelmed in social situations and would often get over emotional. Everyone could see that. Sometimes I’ll talk about something i dont understand on a loop, I talk out loud to process how I feel and sometimes I get into a sheer panic over something that others just won’t understand or how overwhelming that can feel. 

I stim and I wasn’t aware I did that. I will talk at you about whatever I’m most interested in because I want you to feel as excited, happy, curious & joyful about it as I do. 

I always need a plan. I always need to know what’s happening next and I’ll often ask others what might happen in a situation I’ve never been in before so I can prepare for it. I follow a routine. I don’t do well with change and can get flustered and sometimes even irrationally angry when it occurs. And I can’t cope with waiting. 

Tomorrow is the 6 week mark of my autism assessment. They told me they’d contact me in 5-6 weeks to arrange going over the results. So now every email, text or alert on my phone is sending me into a hyper vigilance, excitement sweats then disappointment when it’s not what I’m waiting for it to be😬

Image description: rue power dressing to pass the time in a new beloved 70s denim Levi cowboy hat, secondhand denim & diamanté crop top with shredded white tasseled trousers, a white blazer and silver metallic boots with zig zag heels. 

#neurodivergence  #neurodivergent #autismacceptance #cowboyfashion #visabilityfordisability #babewithamobilityaid #disabilityawareness #dopaminedressing #autisticwomen #secondhandfashion #vintagefashion

I’ve struggled to brush my teeth since childhood. Why is it always mint. It’s chalky, gritty & makes me gag. I’ve tried every kind that isn’t traditional & all gross. But this is IT. I swear! Gel based, really nice flavours by @hismile I’m in love with pistachio and I’m so fricking happy I wanted everyone else who struggles with toothpaste to know! Please tell every autistic person you know, they will thank you ☺️

Image description: rue a ginger haired autistic disabled woman sits in a wheelchair wearing an orange & pink puff dress waving cool coloured canisters of flavoured toothpaste about absolutely delighted. 

#Autisticfriendlytoothpaste #hismile #autism #actuallyautistic #arfid #autistic #autismawareness #autisticadults #sensorydifficulties #autisticwomen #autisticlife #autismsupport #dopaminedressing #babewithamobilityaid #sustainablefashion
musicInfo/song_name: I See It, I Like It, I Want It

caption:
Ten years on Instagram, I don’t think I’ve changed much 😜

Age 35 to 45 had me making bolder choices and dressing for the pure joy of it. I don’t care what suits me, flatters me or goes together. I don’t care what the fashion rules are. If it catches my eye and I love it, I’m wearing it. 

Although truth as always, these are my dress up days where I do this for my own fun, regulation and because I like to catalogue my clothing. I’m at home all the time chronically ill and 99.9% of the time I wear a grotty old tee and my big beige pants. But I make time to do this as my specialist interest, to retain my sense of identity and to express myself.

Set aside time to repair your clothes with a simple needle and thread. Taking care of your clothes extends the life of them, and can help to reduce your overall environmental impact.

Introductions - come get to know me some 

I’m Rue, a middle aged wee wifie (I’m only 5 5” but everyone thinks I’m taller) living up a hillside in Wales. 

I’m autistic & disabled and my specialist interest is fashion. In particular vintage. But I don’t wear it in a conventional way. I mix vintage with lots of secondhand pieces. And I love guessing the dates of clothing. 

I advocate for #visabilityfordisability in fashion as we make up to 20% of populations and intersect with every minority but are hugely underrepresented in all aspects of life. We need to see disabled people represented on catwalks, fashion shoots, social media pr campaigns, advertising & tv and film and to change the perception of disability as being something to fear and illuminate instead the  #disabledjoy #autisticjoy 

I’m also #chronicallyill and spent 99% of my time at home living in my own wee happy bubble. I plan and pace my time so once a week I can play dress up and indulge in what brings me happiness. The rest of the week I’m in a grotty t shirt & pants for comfort 😁

Today’s outfit is inspired by old period movies like Howard’s end from the 90s that drew heavily from the 70s fashion era for costumes. 

70s Celadon hat, modern pink 70s style glasses, secondhand 70s inspired blouse in a Victorian style, 30s celadon tap pants, mid century yellow plastic necklace and secondhand 90s style yellow platform shoes and my new beloved pink fairytale walking stick from @neowalksticks because mobility aids are epic 🌸

Here are 5 places where I’ll be shopping smart this Black Friday. Swipe to see pieces I’ve bought from them before!

Don’t worry though, these are all secondhand! I love filling up virtual shopping baskets and watching my favourite items from these brands, so this week is an opportunity to save some money whilst buying the things that I need.

🖤 @thrift_plus_uk - Thrift+ wants to encourage people to only shop what they really love - so, they’ve priced dropped 40k+ items by up to 70% that have been favourited by thrifters. 

🖤 @reliked - One of my fav thrifting website, Reliked is having huge discounts this Black Friday on their app. Tip: turn on notifications because the best stuff sells really fast.

🖤 @lespetitschampingnons - you need to know this sweet kids wear company! Les Petit Champignons is doing a 20% off sitewide plus a PCRF charity donation from every order for Black Friday.

🖤 @hirestreetuk - Their everyday value is already better then brands on Black Friday and there will be giveaways + the chance to win your order back!

🖤 @ebay_uk - eBay is already running up to 70% off secondhand fashion. I have a trench coat on my wish list that I planning on taking home.

 #SustainableChoices #BoycottBlackFriday #MindfulConsumption #BlackFriday

For the girlies who say that sustainable fashion is too expensive 🤪 We can absolutely still love fashion while being conscious about the environment at the same time - even if you’re on a budget.

One of the biggest myths I often hear about sustainable fashion is that it is too expensive but this is only true if we buy as much as we’re used to from fast fashion. The golden rule of sustainability is NOT TO BUY! Wear what you already own, swap and buy secondhand first and foremost. 

Trust me, you’ll soon realise that you have a much bigger budget than you’ve imagined to invest in ethically made clothes 💚

It’s pretty simple really ☕️ our sustainable(ish) outfits details

I’m sure you’re also being bombarded with “autumn trends” or “must haves” of the season… 🥱don’t let your FYP fool you into thinking fast fashion is cool or necessary. 

This is your reminder that you probably don’t NEED anything new and you can almost certainly find secondhand clothes to keep you warm and stylish as the seasons change 🍁🍂 🧡 also, Zara can F**K OFF 😅

Outfits I can’t wait to repeat this autumn 🍁🍂 most of which are well over 5 years old or secondhand. I spend very little on clothes and truly believe that a sustainable wardrobe is way cheaper than one full of fast fashion. Only takes a bit more time and care but something’s got to give 👌 surely we can all agree that the wellbeing of the humans who make our clothes surpasses the need for “cute outfits” right?

It’s been a very rainy few weeks in Paris, but I can’t say I mind very much. It always makes me think of those quotes from Midnight in Paris, and I have to say I always did agree with Gil and Gabrielle. There’s something so dreamy about watching people hurry off with their umbrellas, stopping to sip coffee at a café while the rain softly falls, and strolling along the Seine under a misty drizzle. 

Wearing a top and trousers kindly gifted by @sezane with a vintage camel coat and leather bag.

How do you call this jacket? Varsity jacket? College jacket? Letterman jacket? No matter the name, this classic piece keeps making a comeback in men's fashion—or should I say, it never really left!

What about you? Do you have one in your wardrobe?

Outfit of the day:
Beanie: @zeeman_nl
Jacket: Vintage 1971 find from @vinted
Jeans: Raw baggy denim from @zalando
Sneakers: @stussy x @converse collab

Comment appelez-vous cette veste ? Varsity jacket ? Collège jacket ? Letterman jacket ? Peu importe son nom, cette pièce iconique revient toujours dans le vestiaire masculin… ou plutôt, elle ne l’a jamais quitté !

Et vous, en avez-vous une dans votre placard ?

Tenue du jour :
Bonnet : @zeeman_france
Veste : Vintage de 1971 trouvée sur @vinted
Jean : Baggy en denim brut trouvé sur @zalando_street
Sneakers : Collab @stussy x @converse_europe

#menswear #mensfashion #streetwear #fashionstyle #ootdmen #vintagefashion #varsityjacket #lettermanjacket #collegejacket #fashionformen #styleinspo #outfitinspiration #classicstyle #rawdenim #baggyjeans #sneakerhead #sneakerstyle #stussy #converse #streetstyle #fashionaddict #hypebeast #menwithstyle #outfitgrid #fashioncommunity #retrostyle

The flea markets in Paris have become sort of a staple of my weekends. Quite often I don’t have anything I’m looking for and don’t end up bringing anything home, but wandering through the seemingly endless rows of tables filled with antiques, trinkets, and vintage, all unique and full of history, is my idea of a perfect afternoon. Something about those items that have lived multiple lives and survived generations is just so fascinating to me, and I have to say, I’m especially spoiled for the selection at the markets here. 

What other cities do you think have incredible flea markets? Let me know, I need to visit them all!
musicInfo/song_name: The World We Knew (Over And Over)

caption:
Sometimes, I like wearing oversized baggy pants with a pair of sneakers, just like a teenager. Other times, I go for a minimalist and monochrome outfit, more fitted! Today’s look is exactly that—just as effective as a black suit, but in a more relaxed version!

Outfit of the day:
Black denim trucker jacket: @vinted
Black long-sleeve polo: @lacoste
Jeans: @lee
Black leather Chelsea boots: @zign found on @zalando
Beanie: @zeeman_nl

Parfois, j'aime porter de gros baggys avec une paire de sneakers, comme un adolescent, et parfois, je préfère une tenue minimaliste et monochrome, plus ajustée ! C'est le cas de cette tenue, aussi efficace qu’un costume noir, mais dans une version plus décontractée !

Tenue du jour :
Veste trucker en jean noir : @vinted
Polo noir manches longues : @lacoste
Pantalon jean : @lee
Chelsea boots en cuir noir : @zign trouvées sur @zalando
Bonnet : @zeeman_nl

#OOTD #MinimalStyle #CasualChic #BlackOnBlack #Streetwear #FashionInspo #ModeHomme #MensFashion #StyleMinimaliste #LookDuJour #OutfitInspiration #AllBlackEverything #ChicDécontracté #StyleHomme #MonochromeFit #JeanStyle #Lacoste #LeeJeans #Zign #Zeeman #VintedFinds #FashionMood #MenWithStyle #EffortlessLook #CasualElegance #TimelessFashion #Menswear

Why wear a black suit when you can go for a trendy, monochrome denim set?

All you need is a good trucker-style denim jacket, slightly cropped, paired with black jeans. I had these tailored for a slimmer fit, and to take the look up a notch, I added a sleek pair of Chelsea leather boots. Under the jacket, I’m wearing a long-sleeve black polo from Lacoste.

Outfit of the day:
Black denim trucker jacket: @vinted
Black long-sleeve polo: @lacoste
Jeans: @leejeans
Black leather Chelsea boots: @zign found on @zalando
Beanie: @zeeman_nl

Pourquoi porter un costume noir quand on peut opter pour un ensemble en jean, monochrome et tendance ?

Il suffit d’une bonne veste en jean style trucker, légèrement crop, assortie à un jean noir. Celui-là, je l’ai fait retailler pour une coupe plus "slim". Et pour élever le niveau, une belle paire de boots en cuir type Chelsea ! Sous la veste, je porte un polo noir manches longues de chez Lacoste.

Tenue du jour :
Veste trucker en jean noir : @vinted
Polo noir manches longues : @lacoste
Pantalon jean : @leejeanseurope
Chelsea boots en cuir noir : @zign trouvées sur @zalando
Bonnet : @zeeman_france

Workwear meets style
The iconic blue chore jacket is a timeless menswear essential that blends functionality and effortless elegance. Originally designed for laborers, its durable fabric and practical design have made it a staple in contemporary wardrobes.

Outfit :
Cap : vintage snapback found on @vinted
Denim jacket : @kiabi
Pants : jeans @levis 545
Chore jacket bleu de travail
Brown leather penny loafers @vinted 

Le workwear au service du style
La veste bleu de travail est une pièce emblématique du vestiaire masculin qui allie fonctionnalité et élégance intemporelle. Conçue à l'origine pour les ouvriers, sa toile robuste et son design pratique en ont fait un incontournable des dressings modernes.

#Workwear #Menswear #ChoreJacket #BlueJacket #HeritageStyle #RawDenim #VintageWorkwear #FrenchWorkwear #ClassicMenswear #DenimStyle #TimelessFashion #RuggedStyle #StreetHeritage #MensStyle #FashionEssentials #WorkwearStyle #UtilityWear #MinimalStyle #HeritageWear #UrbanStyle #CasualChic #StyleInspiration #ModeHomme #WorkwearOutfit #EffortlessStyle #OutfitInspiration

Don't wear a chore jacket because it's trendy, but wear it because it’s a timeless piece that blends style, function, and history. Originally designed for hard work, it carries a story with every fade and crease, adapting effortlessly to your lifestyle. It’s not just fashion—it’s character.

Ne porte pas une veste de travail parce que c'est tendance, mais parce qu'elle est intemporelle, alliant style, fonctionnalité et histoire. Conçue à l'origine pour le travail, elle se façonne au fil du temps, chaque pli et chaque patine racontant une histoire. Ce n'est pas juste de la mode, c'est du caractère. 

Outfit :
Cap : vintage snapback found on @vinted
Denim jacket : @kiabi
Pants : jeans @levis 545
Chore jacket bleu de travail
Brown leather penny loafers @vinted

Why settle for basic cargo pants when you can wear stylish camo pants? Camo adds a bold and unique touch to any outfit. Versatile, comfortable, and always on-trend, it fits every style, from streetwear to casual chic.

Dare to stand out with camo that makes a statement. So, are you team cargo or team camo? Let us know in the comments and tag someone who needs to try this look!

Outfit of the day :
Beanie @forever21
Quilted jacket : @vinted
Camo cargo pants : @vinted
Sneakers : @converse x @commedesgarcons

Pourquoi se contenter d’un simple pantalon cargo quand on peut porter un pantalon camouflage ultra stylé ? Le camo apporte une touche d’audace et d’originalité à n’importe quelle tenue. Polyvalent, confortable et toujours tendance, il s’adapte à tous les looks, du streetwear au casual chic.

Osez affirmer votre style avec un camo qui fait la différence. Alors, team cargo ou team camo ? Dites-le en commentaire et taguez quelqu’un qui devrait essayer ce look !

#CamoStyle #StreetwearVibes #FashionStatement #CamoPants #StyleGameStrong #OOTD #MensFashion #UrbanStyle #TrendyLooks #CasualWear #OutfitInspo #ModeHomme #StreetwearAddict #FashionGoals #CoolOutfits #Hypebeast #StyleInspiration #ModeUrbaine #Menswear #DripCheck #TrendyFit #UrbanFashion #HypeCulture #FashionAddict #LookDuJour #StayStylish

A casual look with a touch of style. Loose military camo cargo pants and a quilted jacket—perfect for combining comfort and fashion. The Converse add the ideal casual touch to complete the outfit. Ready to take on the day with a look that’s both practical and cool.

A mix of comfort and style with this streetwear look. From bold camouflage to a cozy jacket, it's all in the details. And of course, the Converse to finish it off in style. 

Outfit of the day :
Beanie @forever21
Quilted jacket : @vinted
Camo cargo pants : @vinted

Outfits of 2024 in photos 🎞️ 

I’m still easing slowly into the new year, and as I’ve been living in my holiday jammies for the last week or so, I’m gathering up some inspiration from the 2024 archives for when getting dressed becomes a requirement again. Looking forward to experimenting more with vintage styles, pops of colour, and a little more whimsy this year. I’m curious - which month’s outfit would you be most likely to wear?

.
.
.
Yearly recap, outfits of the year, outfit inspiration, vintage mood, parisian style #parisianaesthetic #vieparisienne #lightacademiaaesthetic #vintagemood #lightacademia #pinterestaesthetic #parisiennestyle #romanticacademia #romanticstyle #classicstyle #thriftedstyle #secondhandstyle

You know what they say, if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it. 🤷🏼‍♀️ It might just be the impact of the events of the last few months, but I’ve decided not to make any major resolutions for the new year this time around. I do like to make smaller goals throughout the year to keep me motivated, but the idea of making a big resolution to keep for the year ahead can be so daunting, and especially so after all the recent change in my life. Rather than put pressure on myself to become my “best self” or check off a list of accomplishments by December 31, I’m simply going to continue to work towards embracing my most authentic self, just as I am. 

What about you, are you making any resolutions this year, or focusing on smaller goals and wins?

.
.
.
New year resolutions, new year’s eve, bubble bath, self care #romanticizeyourlife #pinterestaesthetic #parisianvibe #slowandsimpledays #cinematicmoments #feminineenergy #vintageinspired #intentionalliving #frenchmood

There’s truly no place like home for the holidays… just a few lovely moments from my trip back to our home up north 🎞️

- had to take advantage of access to a tub with a couple bubble baths
- forever love opening the door to my mom’s high school needlework art project
- mornings that turned into afternoons cuddled on the couch with coffee 
- a trip to our must visit thrift shop in gravenhurst, currie’s 
- Stefan the snowman was our guest over the holidays
- the bakery in town looking extra charming in the snow
- my favourite little garden cherub tucked in for winter
- Lulu’s annual under the tree photo
- got a little gussied up to go to the casino on new year’s eve, complete with my nana’s earrings
- how I’ll miss these little corners filled with memories
- never ending snow, making everything look a little more magical

Why settle for a Barbour when you can rock a thrifted cotton waxed jacket with even more style? It's all about finding unique pieces that stand out. I know the purists might lose their hair over this, but it's all in good fun and love! Who's with me on this one?

Pourquoi se contenter d'une Barbour quand on peut porter une veste en coton ciré de seconde main avec encore plus de style ? Trouver des pièces uniques, c'est ce qui fait la différence. Je sais que les puristes vont perdre leurs cheveux, mais c'est que du second degré et de l'amour ! Vous êtes d'accord ?

Beanie @zeeman_nl
Waxed cotton jacket, Barbour style @vinted

#Menswear #Streetwear #MensFashion #StyleInspiration #OOTD #MensStyle #CasualStyle #FashionForMen #StreetStyle #MenswearStyle #StyleMen #FashionAddict #DressedUp #MenswearDaily #ClassicStyle #TrendyMen #SharpDressedMan #EverydayWear #FashionGoals #UrbanStyle #StylishMen #MensOutfits #MensFashionPost #StreetFashion #MenswearInspo #MenWithStyle #OutfitGoals

Outfit of the day: To face the cold in style, I went for a waxed canvas Barbour-style jacket. This hybrid piece, blending classic and streetwear elements, adds a timeless yet functional vibe to my look. 👌 The waxed fabric keeps out the wind and rain while remaining super light and comfy.
I paired it with vintage @armandthierry corduroy pants for a soft texture that contrasts nicely with the sturdiness of the jacket. @saucony Omni Grid sneakers complete the look, offering both comfort and performance with every step.
A perfect combo for a look that’s both stylish and laid-back.

Tenue du jour : Pour affronter le froid avec style, je suis parti sur une veste en toile enduite de type Barbour. Ce modèle hybride entre le classique et le streetwear ajoute une touche intemporelle et fonctionnelle à mon look. 👌 La toile enduite protège du vent et de la pluie tout en restant super légère et confortable.
J’ai choisi un pantalon vintage en velours @armandthierry pour une texture douce qui contraste avec la robustesse de la veste. Les sneakers @saucony Omni Grid viennent compléter le tout, offrant confort et performance à chaque pas.
Une combinaison parfaite pour un look à la fois chic et décontracté.

Le streetwear ne se résume pas à la simple commodité – c’est aussi une question d’affirmer son style. Un grand manteau en laine associé à une écharpe confortable apporte ce parfait équilibre entre fonctionnalité et élégance. Les mois d'hiver ne sont pas une excuse pour négliger la mode, et avec ces pièces intemporelles, vous êtes prêts à arpenter les rues avec style. Superposez les couches, restez au chaud, et gardez ce côté urbain.

How to crop a jacket ?

A few days ago, I decided to shorten a jacket I had for a while. I found it too long and the cut less modern. Here’s how I went about it:
First, I measured the desired length.
Then, I unpicked the pockets.
I marked the length with pins, both front and back.
And then, it was time to sew.
I made sure to take my time.
And here’s the result.

What do you think?

Comment crop une veste ?

Il y a quelques jours J'ai décidé de raccourcir une veste que j'avais depuis un moment Je la trouvais trop longue, et la coupe moins actuelle. Voici comment j'ai procédé
D'abord mesurer la longueur souhaitée
Découdre les poches
Marquer la longueur avec des épingles devant et derrière

Better than buying a new jacket – why not make one yourself? I had this quilted jacket with a velvet collar for a while, but it was too long for my taste. So, I decided to shorten it and give it a new life with a more modern cropped fit! What do you think?

Mieux que d’acheter une nouvelle veste, pourquoi ne pas la créer soi-même ? J’avais cette veste matelassée, avec un col en velours, depuis un moment, mais elle était trop longue à mon goût. J’ai donc décidé de la raccourcir pour lui donner une nouvelle vie et un look cropped plus actuel ! Qu'en pensez-vous ?

Don't wear a parka if you're aiming for style and elegance. While it's not the most fashionable choice, it certainly serves a purpose. When the temperatures drop and the cold becomes unbearable, there's no better way to stay warm and protected. Style may come at a cost, but warmth is priceless.

Outfit of the day:

Cap: GMC truck vintage trucker hat found on @vinted

Pants: Chino celio 

Sneakers: Jordan 11 Bred

Parka: @thenorthface Himalayan Retro 94

Ne portez pas de parka si vous cherchez à être élégant et stylé. Bien qu'elle ne soit pas le choix le plus tendance, elle a un rôle essentiel. Quand les températures chutent et que le froid devient intense, rien de mieux pour se protéger et rester au chaud. Le style a un prix, mais la chaleur est inestimable.

Dinan is seriously straight out of a fairytale! This medieval town is so full of charm and history, and felt like taking a step back in time. Walking through the cobblestone streets I could easily picture how it might’ve been back in the days of knights and horse-drawn carriages. The morning I visited the fog was heavy throughout the port and the main town, which only added to the moody, medieval vibe Dinan exudes. 

Dinan is just a 40 minutes bus ride from Saint-Malo, and I’m so glad I added it to my itinerary!

.
.
.

Eloise at Christmastime, except it’s me and in Paris ✨ 

Eloise at Christmastime was always one of my favourite holiday books when I was young. My dad would sometimes take me to the bookshop after the Santa Clause Parade in Toronto to pick a new holiday book and this is one I continued to come back to year after year. I could always relate to Eloise’s level of enthusiasm for the holidays and her need to spread festive cheer, and found the illustrations just so fun and whimsical. It wasn’t until I was in high school that I realized there was a film adaptation as well, and quickly added it to my holiday movie list. Did you have a favourite holiday book growing up too?

.
.
.
.
Paris at Christmas, Place Vendome, Louis Vuitton carousel, December in Paris, vintage inspired, vintage coat, Parisian holidays #vintagemood #vintageaesthetic #parisianvibe #parisiennestyle #lestylealafrancaise #pinterestaesthetic

Why Shouldn't You Settle for a Basic Sweater?
Most sweaters sold in stores today are made from polyester, polyamide, or other synthetic materials. They don’t provide proper warmth, make you sweat, and are far from durable. It's time to invest in a high-quality, thick wool sweater. That’s exactly what I did with this collaboration between Aimé Leon Dore and Woolrich, and I couldn’t be happier with the result. This is a true cable-knit sweater in the style of traditional Irish designs—and I absolutely love it!

Pourquoi ne faut-il pas acheter un simple pull ?
La plupart des pulls vendus dans le commerce aujourd'hui sont en polyester, polyamide ou tout autre matière synthétique. Ça ne tient pas chaud correctement, ça fait transpirer, et évidemment, ça ne dure pas dans le temps. Il est temps d’investir dans un vrai pull en laine bien épais. C’est ce que j’ai fait avec cette collaboration entre Aimé Leon Dore et Woolrich, et j’en suis très satisfait. Un vrai pull en maille tressée façon pull irlandais, j’adore !

Happy Jude Law flirtation season to all who celebrate ✨

The Holiday has been one of my go-to Christmas movies since it first came out - something about it just feels extra sparkly and cozy at the same time. One of my own little traditions every year is to make a “Christmas fettucine” à la Iris Simpkins to eat while I watch it and inevitably swoon over the male leads. For my fellow fans of the film, I need to know - are you team Graham, or team Miles?

Filmed at an extra cozy pub in Galway, with an obligatory Irish coffee and perfectly Amanda Woods-esque knit from @sezane (gifted) 🤍

.
.
.
.
Christmas movies, festive season, holiday traditions, Jude Law, Jack Black, Nancy Meyers, rom-coms, Galway, Ireland, Irish pub, Sézane #cozyaesthetic #romanticizeyourlife #vintagemood #theholiday #academiaaesthetic

Richelle searches for sea shells on the Salthill sea shore 🐚

I stayed a little outside the city centre when I was in Galway, and besides the fact that it ended up being a really lovely place, it was so nice to be so close to the ocean. My apartments in Toronto always ended up being close to the lake, and I loved going for walks by the quays and waterfront. I often catch myself gravitating towards bodies of water, whether it’s walks along the Seine or the river at my parents house. The smell of the saltwater in the wind, sea shells littered along the beach, and squawks of the sea gulls made staying in Salthill such a joy for me. 

Wearing my trusty thrifted trench coat, Monoprix scarf, and @sezane cardigan, jeans and loafers (kindly gifted).

.

.
.

I’m continuing to share my best tips to stay stylish without breaking the bank! Thanks to second-hand apps, outlets, affordable stores, and other great deals, you can find trendy pieces at a fraction of the price.

Here’s an example: this entire outfit cost me only €29! Here’s the breakdown:

- Beanie: from @ca , a women’s model for just €2.
- Denim shirt: a thick, high-quality piece from @kiabi.france , made of recycled denim, bought on sale for €5.
- Black wool pants: bought on Vinted @vinted for €2, which I tailored for a perfect fit.
- Chunky-sole loafers: €20 from @zaraman .

What do you think?

Je continue à partager avec vous mes astuces pour rester stylé(e) sans se ruiner ! Entre les applications de seconde main, les outlets, les enseignes à petit prix et d'autres bons plans, il est tout à fait possible d'acheter des pièces tendance à des prix mini.

Voici un exemple : cette tenue complète m’a coûté seulement 29€ ! Voici le détail :

- Bonnet : trouvé chez C&A, un modèle femme à seulement 2€.
- Chemise en jean : une pièce épaisse et de qualité de chez Kiabi, faite en jean recyclé, achetée en soldes pour 5€.
- Pantalon en laine noir : trouvé pour 2€ sur Vinted, que j’ai retaillé pour un fit parfait.
- Mocassins à semelle chunky: 20€ chez Zara.

Layering is truly an art! Every fall and winter, we hear about how to master it. But how do you stack layers with style without ending up looking like Joey from *Friends*?!

Over the past few seasons, brands like Bonne Gueule, Aime Leon Dore, Ralph Lauren, and others have popularized the look. Whether you’re a fan of layering or not, you won’t be able to escape it this winter!

For this outfit:
- New Era New York Mets cap @neweracap
- Workwear-style overshirt found on @vinted
- Quilted jacket with a velvet collar @vinted
- Beige pleated chinos celio
- Black leather loafers

The bomber jacket, or flight jacket for the purists, is a staple of men's fashion. My first memories of it go back to the '90s. Everyone at school was wearing one. The lucky ones had @schottnyc_europe jackets, while I got a second-hand COMPLICES. But I was still happy. 

It fell out of style for a while but made a comeback, thanks in part to Kanye West in the early 2010s! Once worn slim, it's been revived in oversized fits over the last few years. 

This one is a @vinted find, bought for just a few euros. The outfit is inspired by @xxjmitch for his collaboration with @madewellmens . And as for the video, @derrick_b_smith  that's where I drew my inspiration!

All you need is... Not love but shortsleeve shirt for this summer ! Oversize, slim, cuban collar, crochet, coton, silk or whatever it is, it's a summer must have.

A pair of @converse Chuck Taylor 70 low

Question of the day : should we still Wear Adidas Stan Smith ?!!

Do you think this is a good sneakers ? Or should we let it rest ? (@borasification told me for him it's the best sneakers of all Time ! 😋😘)

Yesterday I was in my Magnum PI Vibe (shout out to @paris.haven who inspired me the Idea!). I wanted a rétro style outfit with a dad fit jeans, a polo shirt, a vintage cap and of course a mustache !
To keep it vintage, I thought about my old Stan Smith who were sleeping in my shoes closet. For me it's the perfect match. 

10 years ago, it's was a Big hype, way before samba, gazelle and spezial or other classic adidas sneakers. 

Now the hype is over and that's a good thing, I Can get it Back in my shoes rotation !

I received this Levis 550 few days ago, I love the baggy/carrot cut and the color of this jeans. 
It's almost the same cut as the Levis 545 that I wore on a previous vidéo. 

What do you think about this jeans ?

A vintage nascar snapback cap

Slow afternoons and a good read 📚 After taking my sweet time, I’ve finally finished reading The Secret History, and I absolutely get the hype now. The plot, settings, character descriptions and even the smallest seemingly insignificant details were all exactly what I hoped this book to be. I definitely did not see that ending coming, but perhaps that’s another reason I enjoyed it so much. Taking any and all recommendations for similar reads below please!

You're not dreaming ! It's that time of the year, the Big coat Season (or grandad coat as @grutierophile_nocturne said !)

Who love this Season ?? 🙋‍♂️

The #layering Season where you can wear a shirt under a sweater under a jacket under a coat etc etc ... You don't know how to dress for fall or winter or how to style a Big coat ? Maybe I Can help you with this outfit

The #bigcoat is from Vinted, 100% wool, really thick and oversize, I paid around 25€ for it. 
The white Chino, it's a vintage #celio found @guerrisolfrance I resize it, it was too wide. 
I added a good ol turtle neck sweater and a wool jacket and I have the perfect History Teacher style !

It's another try for the bonnegueule contest about layering #bonnegueuleconcours1 ! 
.

Question of the day : Do you wear short ? 
I've discovered that some m'en never wear short ! It's pretty surprising but I can understand. It's not really easy to look dapper in short but I'm sure some of you Can. As you can sée, I'm not in that classy dandy dapper mood. My influence are really streetwear. The comfier outfit for me it's an oversize t-shirt, a baggy short and a really cool pair of sneakers of course !
But sometimes I want to upgrade my style so I decided to wear my crochet short (favorite short of the moment btw) with a large shortsleeve shirt, cuban collar that I cropped a little bit. 
On my feet, some #adidasrivalry.
I'm more info Nike (as you Can see in the background) but adidas classic are Always good ! 

Shirt : #thrifted on #vinted
Short : #primark
Shoes : Adidas Rivalry low from @zalando 
.

Do I need to remind you that I'm addicted to #thrifting , #secondhand  clothes and I spend a lot of  money on #Vinted (in fact, not that much !). 
I Always have target in mind and I won't stop digging until I found the perfect treasure. It means : good product at a good Price ! I used to look for sneakers, but my sneakers closet is full now, so it's time to find some jacket for the autumn !

This is one is an all black varsity Jacket, with real leather sleeves, oversized fitting (it's a size XL). I sew a patch on it because I wanted to cover the brand. 
I only paid 15€ for it (around 15$ for my american Friends !). The seller was @barpullvintage

Can't wait to Wear it !

T-shirt : basic #h&M t-shirt 
Pants : suit pants also from Vinted
Shoes : #airjordan3 white cement reimagined. I'm in love with these shoes. I could Wear it every day !

en voyant cette paire est-ce qu’on pourrait croire qu’elle a été reconditionnée ? 🤭♻️ @claquettesmarket redonne une seconde vie aux chaussures qui présentent un petit défaut et que les marques ne peuvent pas vendre dans leurs boutiques, après avoir été reconditionnées les chaussures sont mises en vente avec une réduction de -50% sur le prix d’origine ✨
Archi fan du concept, et vous ? 🫶🏻

*produit offert*

Part 3 : how to style a wool thrifted pants found for 2€ on #Vinted ? This is the last outfit, I know you was waiting for it ! The third outfit is more #casual, a street style version for men. 

If you want to wear a formal suit pants for a non formal day, it's really easy, break the code with a pair of sneakers, a t-shirt and accessories as a beanie or a cap. As you may know I a hat lover, I don't know if I have more caps, beanie and hat or shoes/sneakers. 😅

The beanie : a blue beanie thrifted @guerrisolfrance 
T-shirt : classic oversize t-shirt from @primark.man

What's the most important piece of your closet ? For me, 2 things :
First : Hat : I Always Wear something on my head, it Can be a beanie, a hat, or a vintage snapback cap from my collection. 
Second : sneakers or shoes in general ! As you see on my feed or story, I'm a Big shoes lover, I can wear one different pair of shoes per day during 5 months. I know I'm not the only one here with this sickness ! 

This outfit is really simple, plain overshirt black t-shirt with a tennis light Yellow short. The cherry on the cake is the cap and my Jordan 3 fire red !

T-shirt : simple t-shirt from #primark

Paris photo dump. We're back in Paris for few days. We moved 6 years ago to Bordeaux, it was the best choice of our life but it's a pleasure to be back. Only for few days and do tourist thing like fly boat, Eiffel tower with our daughter ! 

Of course I have to be fresh and fly for the fashion capital ! As you Can see, my Venezia vintage cap is the perfect choice ! 

This is a simple classic streetwear outfits for men when it's hot in summer but not too much. 

Hat : vintage snapback from @vinted
Shirt : a shortsleeve shirt, silk effect. It's a 3XL size for the perfect oversize effect. Also from #vinted
Pants : grandpa pants from thrift @guerrisolfrance 
Shoes : my favorite #newbalance990v3 Marble head color by @teddysantis

🍒CONCOURS🍒 (terminé)

Ça fait maintenant 2 ans et demi que j’ai commencé ma chaîne Youtube et on est déjà plus de 12 000 🥹 Pour vous remercier de me soutenir j’ai envie de vous offrir un cadeau…trois gros cadeaux pour être exacte 🤭
Trois gagnant(e)s recevront 1 bon d’achat d’une valeur de 100€ valable sur l’ensemble de ma friperie 🫶🏻
Le concours se termine le 8 septembre à 18h et les gagnants seront tirés au sort ce jour là 🌞

Pour participer il suffit de :
-me suivre @lauvestds 🍒
-liker et enregistrer ce post
-taguer 2 ami(e)s dans les commentaires
-BONUS : partager ce post en story 🫶🏻

#concours #concoursinstagram #giveaway #giveaways #friperie #thriftstorefinds #thriftshop #vintage #secondemain #secondhand #ecofashion #fall #fallfashion #outfitinspiration #outfitideas

bye 2024 🤍
l’année qui vient de se terminer a été incroyable, j’ai voyagé, découvert des marques éthiques, chiné tout l’été en brocante, vu des concerts, fait mon premier voyage seule, vu un match de football en Espagne, on a aménagé notre voiture et surtout notre plus gros projet : on a acheté une maison pour la rénover 🥹✨
J’ai hâte de découvrir ce que 2025 me réserve 🤍🥂

People often tell me you can’t wear a cap with loafers. Personally, I think that’s just a cliché—I do it all the time, and it works perfectly! What do you think?

Outfit of the day:

Cap: New Era New York Yankees

Oversized sweater: celio

Vintage Levi’s 545 jeans: @ltrainvintage

Brown leather penny loafers: @vinted

Beige trench coat: #vinted

Every corner of Dublin tells a story, and I was eager to listen to them all. 

——

One project from elementary school that often stands out in my memory is one that was assigned about the country of our heritage, its culture, and its traditions, that concluded in a big showcase in the gymnasium. I remember asking my mom where we came from and which country I should do, since my heritage is quite a mix and many generations Canadian. I learned her side has strong roots in Ireland and Scotland, so I decided to pick Ireland as the focus of my project. I still remember how intrigued I was by all that I was learning about the country in my research, and proudly sharing it all with my classmates in that gymnasium.

I’ve clearly felt strong ties to other countries as well having recently moved to France, but Ireland has always been high up on the travel bucket list, and ever since that one project I’ve felt most connected to my Irish ancestry out of all our other countries of origin. 

Although I’ve barely scratched the surface of the emerald isle on this trip, being able to finally visit the country where my ancestors once lived and see it all in person was such an unforgettable experience, and I already know I’ll definitely be back again soon. 

.
.
.

musicInfo/song_name: i like the way you kiss me

caption:
Safe to say this autumn has been a little different than usual: settling into life in a new country, kicking off the season in Spain rather than with Canadian Thanksgiving, and hunting for fall foliage in polished parks rather than cottage country, but I’m starting to embrace the fact that change, in life just as in the seasons, is inevitable, and “different” can be just as, and sometimes even more, wonderful as the usual. I tend to get very stuck in my ways, routines, and made-up traditions, but all this change is the push I needed to see things from a different perspective, shake things up a little, and appreciate my new ways of being just as they are. 

Photos by the lovely @brunetteroyalty 🤎

.
.
.
.
.

caption:
A slow morning, hot coffee and a good read is my kind of Sunday. Although my mornings haven’t been quite this peaceful recently, it just means I’m appreciating the drawn out, unhurried mornings with some quiet time even more. Do you prefer a slow morning to ease into the day too, or do you wake up ready to take it on?

.
.
.
.
.
Slow living, Sunday morning, cozy aesthetic, light academia, vintage mood, simple joys, romanticizing life #cozyaesthetic #romanticizeyourlife #slowandsimpledays #simplepleasures #vintagemood

.
.
.
.

Life in Paris, parisian apartment, living in Paris, romanticizing life, croissants, parisian aesthetic, slow mornings #frenchmood #vieparisienne #lestyleàlafrançaise #parisianvibe #parisianaesthetic #beparisian #romanticizeyourlife #vintagefeeling #lightacademia #cosyvibes #slowandsimpledays #pinterestaesthetic

One of the things preparing for my move that’s been quite difficult for me is having to pack away the little world I’ve created in my apartment. As exciting as it is to start fresh and experience something completely new, I can’t help but feel a little sentimental about all the things I’ve collected and thoughtfully placed to create my home. From the knick-knacks my grandma gave me when I was little to the vintage candelabra I found on a trip, there’s little pieces of my life scattered throughout my apartment. I just have to remember that there are more treasures and memories to find along the way, and as long as I have pictures, and music, and everything beautiful, I can make my own little world wherever I choose it to be. 

.
.
.
.
.

caption:
For your comfort: there’s probably a bird with a nest made with some of your hair somewhere. The bunny you stopped your car for probably had a long life and lots of babies. The turtle you helped to the side of the road made a little kid squeal with joy. The worm you didn’t step on probably made someone’s garden very happy. The coin you dropped on the street turned a stranger’s bad day into a lucky one. The moon was listening, you weren’t really alone. 

.
.
.
.

caption:
This Saturday I had the pleasure of visiting @cruickstonpark - a family owned private estate with luxury guesthouses and a charming farm less than 2 hours from the city. 

We did yoga in the gardens, made some new friends on the farm, enjoyed brunch in the cottage, and I even got to try milking a goat (if it weren’t for the watchful moms I definitely would’ve tried to take one of the babies home with me… I mean can you blame me?)

It’s such an enchanting spot for a weekend getaway and the entire morning felt like I’d stepped right into a fairytale in the English countryside. 

Check out their page to stay updated on upcoming events and to learn more about booking a guesthouse for your own fairytale getaway 🤍 (hosted/pr)

.
.
.
.

Painting the roses red 🌹

Does anyone remember the story of Snow White and Rose Red? In classic Grimms’ Fairy Tale fashion the story is a little dark and bizarre but it’s a classic tale of the benefits of kindness and compassion, complete with an evil dwarf and a bear-turned-prince. For some reason I was always partial to Rose Red over the other tales and characters in the book, and the embroidery on this dress always reminds me of her strange little story. 

Wearing my Rose Red dress from @rihoas_official, thrifted cardigan, mary-janes from @poppybarley and vintage Prada bag.

An ode to the rainy days of spring 🌧️ To me, rain feels like a reminder to slow down. A rainy day has no expectations, no pressure. It’s a chance to hit pause, take a breath, and soak in the quiet moments. 

Do you also enjoy a rainy day?

#romanticizeyourlife #slowandsimpledays #vintagemood #softliving #pinterestaesthetic #vintagemood

Anemoia (n): Nostalgia for a time or a place one has never known. The wistful yearning for a past era, often triggered by encountering artifacts or cultural remnants from that time. Feeling connected to a bygone era, despite never having lived in it oneself. 

Do you ever experience anemoia? It’s a feeling I’m all too familiar with, especially when it comes to the eras in which my parents grew up. 🤍

April through my camera roll:

1. An absolutely incredible jacket at my favourite @torontovintageclothingshow 
2. Tea time with mother dearest on the porch
3 & 4. A rare late night out needed documenting
5. Hints of pink on my bedside table to welcome spring
6. My yoga pilates fusion class on Tuesdays has been kicking my butt
7. Showering a lovely friend ahead of her nuptials - when did we get old enough to get married?!
8. Bubble bath with a side of @ripleynetflix
9. Obsessing over the florals at a work event
10. Gordo the groundhog waiting patiently for his piña colada

Now waiting patiently for those May flowers 🌷

As explained so eloquently by Queen Clarisse Renaldi of Genovia, “A queen is never late, everyone else is simply early.” 🤷🏼‍♀️

Rarely can you see the full story only a few pages in. Don’t be afraid to cross things out, tear out the page or move on to a new chapter. You can throw in a plot twist or change the genre any time you like. Every setback or stumble is a chance to edit and refine. You are the author of your own story, and you get to choose how it unfolds.

As soon as the weather starts getting even a little warm, I find myself reaching for my more vintage and retro inspired pieces. Despite always incorporating some aspect of vintage into my outfits, something about the vibe of the late 60’s/early 70’s just feels right for the start of spring (whenever it actually arrives that is). With the vest and capri trends on the rise this season, and new series like Palm Royale (which looks like a retro aesthetic feast for the eyes and is absolutely on my to-watch list), it seems others have the same idea. Is there a specific decade you feel drawn to these days too?

.
.
.
.

“My little Amélie, you don’t have bones of glass. You can take life’s knocks. If you let this chance pass, eventually, your heart will become as dry and brittle as my skeleton.” | “Voilà, ma petite Amélie, vous n’avez pas des os en verre. Vous pouvez vous cogner à la vie. Si vous laissez passer cette chance, alors avec le temps, c’est votre cœur qui va devenir aussi sec et cassant que mon squelette.”

I recently had the pleasure of seeing the 4K restoration of Amélie in the theatre, and although I’ve seen it countless times, seeing it on the big screen like that reignited my love of the film and the joy it brings me. I’m always talking about running off to Paris, but after watching the restored film I really craved a long walk through Montmartre’s winding streets and a good crème brûlée. Seeing your favourite movie on the big screen is just such a special experience, and you can bet I listened to the soundtrack all the way home. Is there a special film you’d love to see in theatres?

And thank you to @vicfilippini for finding out about the showing and bringing me along! 💌

.
.
.
.

If the weather forecast for the rest of the month in Toronto goes as predicted, it’s looking like we may have had the last of the winter chill for the season. It does feel strange that we’ve had such a mild winter compared to previous years and much less snow than usual, but I can’t help but look on the bright side and enjoy the warmer temperatures and sunshine making an appearance over the last week or so.  I do have a few winter pieces I wish I’d gotten more wear out of this year, but I’ll happily swap my heavy coats and boots for flats and bare legs early this year. While the warmer weather is probably a cause for concern in the grander scheme of things, I’ll still take it over a slushy, wet winter any day. 

.
.
.
.

I’m continuing to share my best tips to stay stylish without breaking the bank! Thanks to second-hand apps, outlets, affordable stores, and other great deals, you can find trendy pieces at a fraction of the price.

Here’s an example: this entire outfit cost me only €29! Here’s the breakdown:

- Beanie: from @ca , a women’s model for just €2.
- Denim shirt: a thick, high-quality piece from @kiabi.france , made of recycled denim, bought on sale for €5.
- Black wool pants: bought on Vinted @vinted for €2, which I tailored for a perfect fit.
- Chunky-sole loafers: €20 from @zaraman .

What do you think?

Je continue à partager avec vous mes astuces pour rester stylé(e) sans se ruiner ! Entre les applications de seconde main, les outlets, les enseignes à petit prix et d'autres bons plans, il est tout à fait possible d'acheter des pièces tendance à des prix mini.

Voici un exemple : cette tenue complète m’a coûté seulement 29€ ! Voici le détail :

- Bonnet : trouvé chez C&A, un modèle femme à seulement 2€.
- Chemise en jean : une pièce épaisse et de qualité de chez Kiabi, faite en jean recyclé, achetée en soldes pour 5€.
- Pantalon en laine noir : trouvé pour 2€ sur Vinted, que j’ai retaillé pour un fit parfait.
- Mocassins à semelle chunky: 20€ chez Zara.

Qu'en pensez-vous ?

They say you can tell a lot about a woman by what’s in her handbag. Well, here’s what’s in mine:
 
- @radleylondon wallet stuffed to the brim with membership cards from every store I’ve ever walked into
- French anise candies with a tin too cute to leave behind at the cash register
- My grandma’s vintage  compact that still has the sifter
- An oversized hair clip to hold the lion’s mane on my head
- Homemade lavender hand cream my mom made
- My good luck Greedo - he goes by Tony (and no I’m not a Star Wars fan)
- A book of poems and excerpts about positivity and gratitude that was also my grandmother’s
- Lipstick du jour - here we have @lesfillesenrouje Caroline
- Lip balm for under the lipstick - I love @nuxeca Rêve de Miel
- Alternating perfume samples for when I forget to put some on before leaving the house 
- A few loose bobby pins for good measure 

What’s in yours? 

(Bag is vintage)

.
.
.
.

Only four days into the new year, and yet somehow it both feels like the holidays were weeks ago as well as just yesterday. It’s easy to get caught up in trying to conquer your goals and resolutions right away to keep the momentum going, but remember that you have another 361 days to go. You don’t need to have a brand new routine already mastered, or have made a bunch of big changes in the last few days. It’s all about the small steps you take everyday that will lead you to where you want to go, and there doesn’t have to be a firm deadline for that. Let’s be a bit gentler with ourselves this year, shall we? 

Trench and bag thrifted, shirt from @frankandoak, dress from @wearfranc, tights from amazon and shoes from @poppybarley ✨

.
.

.

Figured it was a good time for a little re-introduction - here’s a bit about me ✨ 

Hi, I’m Richelle. 

I live in downtown Toronto with my senior dog Lulu. I’m a Gemini/Cancer cusp sun, Libra rising and Scorpio moon. 

I’ve studied fashion design, business and digital communications, and developed an infatuation for the fashion world at a very young age. 

I have a love of Parisian style, vintage, and about 75% of my wardrobe is thrifted. I would consider myself a francophile, and I believe in romanticizing the everyday. 

I’ve been sharing my style online in various mediums for longer than I can remember, and I can’t picture my life without documenting my silly little outfits and creative ideas. 
 

.
.
. 
.
.

Get dressed with me to run errands on a sunny, autumn day!

Little back story: I fell in love with this dress when I first saw it online, but I was having issues placing an order. The site also said it was sold out in-store, so I accepted my fate that it just wasn’t going to work out this time. Imagine my delight when I went to pick up something else in-store and saw the dress hanging at the end of a rack in my size! I love when a piece just feels meant to be. 🤎

My wrap dress is from the @uniqlocanada x @clarewaightkeller collection, the headband is from @clubmonaco, my earrings are from @mejuri’s Charlotte collection, my shoes are @colehaan that I shopped from my mom’s closet, my trench coat is thrifted, and my purse is from @beara_beara 🤎

.
.
.

caption:
Well, there’s no more denying it - winter has arrived in Toronto. I’ve been trying to stay in a delulu it’s-still-autumn-and-not-that-cold-out mindset the last few weeks, but the temperatures have dropped, the first few snowflakes of the year have started floating past my window, and my winter coats are back hanging in my closet. The arrival of the long Ontario winter has always been a bit of a struggle despite living here my whole life, but I do love the sparkle that comes with the holiday season, and am definitely looking forward to getting into cozy, festive mode now that we have the weather to match. 

What about you - are you still soaking in the last days of autumn, or are you already full festive? 

.
.
. 
.
.
Autumn outfits, fall style inspo, winter outfit, autumn aesthetic, vintage mood, vintage inspired, Parisian style, parisienne, french girl style, dark academia, Silk Maison, Sézane #sezanelovers #romanticizeyourlife #modeparisienne #lesparisiennesdumonde

With my love of trench coats, it’s only natural Lulu should have one too, right? 

There’s just something about a dog in a coat that always puts a smile on my face, and it makes my day when I notice a passerby smiling or a little kid pointing, knowing I can share that little moment of joy with others. 

My trench coat is thrifted, Lulu’s is from H&M years ago, my dress is from @uniqlocanada, my bag is from @beara_beara and my shoes are old @colehaan.
.
.
.
.

I don’t know about you, but as much as I’m looking forward to autumn, the transition of seasons has really been throwing me for a loop this time around. I know we have a few weeks until we set the clocks back again, but I’ve realized that the sun setting earlier and rising later is already affecting my routine. I’m noticing myself eating dinner way too late, and hitting snooze far too much in the morning. Over the summer I get so used to those long days of sun, and my brain still wants to believe the sun sets late, not around 7 PM like it has been lately. While I welcome the change of seasons and am looking forward to the cozy months, it seems I might need more time to adjust to the changing in daylight hours than I might have thought... 🍂🕰️ 

.
.
.
.

Something that stuck with me over the last month was some advice that was given to me at a farmer’s market tarot reading. A card simply titled “play” came out in my reading, and it was interpreted as needing more non-judgemental play in my life - doing things just for the enjoyment of them. This really resonated with me as someone who tends to focus on having to be good at something or turn it into something productive, over just taking pleasure in the things I enjoy. Since that reading I’ve been trying to be mindful about incorporating more “play” into my life and focusing on joy rather than overanalyzing everything. 

I was inspired by some photos I came across on Pinterest while I was up north, and thought it would be fun to try recreating something similar. The end result wasn’t exactly what I had envisioned, but I still love how they turned out, and most importantly, I had fun. 

.
.
.
.
.

“I started calling that girl back. The girl who loved living, the girl who danced instead of walking. The girl who had sunflowers for eyes and fireworks in her soul. I started playing music again, hoping she would come out. I started looking for beautiful moments to experience, so she would feel safe enough to show herself, because I knew she was in there. And she needed my kindness and my effort to come to the surface again.” -S.C Lourie @butterfliesandpebbles 

Calling her back in a @sezane cardigan and loafers (both kindly gifted), @winners skirt, vintage bag, and hair clip that belonged to that very girl who danced instead of walking.
